summary: Earn job-relevant credentials with 4.5K+ online programs from 250+ partners.

scraped_reviews.content: So far I'm enjoying the range of subjects that are offered. I like that programs are verified, we're able to get real credit for completion, as well as signed certificates. It still shows me results in Spanish even though I set my primary language to English. I haven't gotten any feedback about this. One thing I would like to see is the option to create a "wishlist" or collection of courses I'd like to take. I think this app will continue to get better!

The app is generally great, but there's one frustrating issue that really needs attention. When I try to upgrade, the payment goes through Google Play, yet your website clearly states in the "How to Pay? article that you only accept credit cards and PayPal, which is confusing. To make matters worse, I can't even use coupon codes on the mobile version, making the experience feel limited and inconvenient!! I hope you can address and clarify this situation as soon as possible!

Very intriguing and no cost to get into a course that you may be interested in "if available" with the option to pay into the course you find for a certificate, college credit, etc. That said this is awesome to at least Download and look through with many courses from multiple colleges and universities. Be sure to read over the course to see how long it lasts, and what you can get if you decided the course is worth paying for.

The October 11 update made the user experience much worse. Before, there was a list of the available videos from a course module that you could pick from. Now you have to browse left/right until you find the video you are looking for. Also, I can't watch the videos offline anymore, even though I downloaded the videos and the icon changed from a down arrow ("download") to a checkmark ("download completed").

So far, i absolutely love the concept. Gives you access to free material, with the option to purchase the certificates, offers full programs, and full degrees. The only thing I have an issue with is the filters lack a few things, such as course length and course type, so you end up having to scroll and click repeatedly if you're looking for specifics in those categories. And there's also no way to save programs to a personal list, so you can't just quickly access them, you have to find them.

A feature should be added where you can save courses/programs/degrees that you're interested in, ideally be able to sort them into "collections" if we so choose as well. And once you've completed something you've saved, it should be moved automatically to the bottom of the collection with some sort of way to immediately know it's been completed (like a shadow effect or COMPLETE stamped across the front, etc.)This will directly correlate to me doing more! Thank you

This app has only one very slight improvement over accessing edX through a browser and that is the ability to download videos. But you can't download the exercises from the course (or even do some of them AT ALL in the app), so working offline is pretty much impossible except for videos (and maybe readings?) Since you have to be online AND in a browser for the exercises anyway, there's no significant advantage using the app to access edX courses. Basically this just takes up memory on a phone.

The experience in this app is terrible compared to Coursera when it comes to usage with intermittent internet access. You would thing downloading the course for offline use would mean just that. Instead, only videos are downloaded and all supporting material STILL requires internet access. In many instances, it is not even possible to open the app without service. I will be unable to finish as many courses as a result of this.

This is a really free, useful, educational app I have known. It provides lots of course and programs for anyone to learn. However, about the functions of the app, it seems not to satisfying me that much. It does: - require faster speed of the Internet to view the course - require to check web-based for some content - Not really user friendly in terms of interface and forms, just good enough to use. I give it 4 stars!

The EdX app remains less than user-friendly and some bugs persist. Course progress is not intuitive on an individual course's menu. Lessons completed are not differentiated from those yet to complete (such as with checkmarks on the Coursera app). All courses, both completed and in-progress, appear on a single courses tab. This is cluttered if you've taken several. Also, course progress isn't always captured when lectures are viewed on the app; I frequently have to redo them on the desktop site.

I'm most disappointed by the response recieved after sending a feedback of my issues. "edX is designed for full browsers on a computer. Though many features of our platform will work in a mobile browser on a phone or tablet or in our app, some more advanced or custom assignments built by course teams may not. In addition payments cannot be made through the app at this time. We recommend using a laptop or desktop and a current version of a web browser such as Chrome or Firefox when needed." üò†

Good concept, poorly executed. A lot of the courses are presented as powerpoint presentations, this would be alright if each 3-5 sentence slide didn't take nearly 10s to load. Every few slides there is usually a short video which has about a 20% chance of playing, otherwise you can read the transcript which tends to be loaded with grammatical errors(a lot of the text slides weren't much better and I think this program would benefit greatly from having course submissions reviewed by a pro writer)

Using their bookkeeping course, the activities are partially hidden at the edge of the screen making it so I can't see the whole activity, and therefore can't actually read the whole question, and sometimes can't see the answers or notes as they trail off past the edge. Other than that major fault the app works well, and I feel like I'm learning what I want to learn

Some moments ago, yes, less than 10 seconds, I tasted the app 5 stars. I must amen this rating. I proceeded to occupy my time with a return to school exercise and downloaded the edX app. My dismay and the reason I will go no further, I encountered the in-app purchase to unlock my lessons, assignments. Somewhere in the disclaimers could you add that it isn't solely an in-app purchase, rather to be completely successful the purchase of "membership" is a fricking requirement. Stingy!

Honestly the app is pretty great for on the go learning, but one issue is a big one. When you've downloaded videos to watch offline and view them full screen there is an "offline" banner that displays at the bottom. This not only covers the playback controls but also part of the video and can't be removed as far as I can tell. This makes it really hard to watch downloaded videos in landscape mode.

edit- they have improved this app a bit, but it still needs work. I can now view and access all of my courses, but cannot use the pronunciation exercises for language learning, nor can I bookmark the sections like you can online. It says pronunciation doesn't work on ios but I'm using android. So, I bumped it up to 3 stars because it's better than nothing I guess. But, it needs a lot more work to be a useful app.

Not allowed to pause videos to see what's on screen. Somehow after ten years this app whose only purpose is to stream video is still by far the worst at it. Edit: I just went and checked and using the webpage in a mobile browser is still better. Whoever got paid to make this app ripped off edx's money lol.

I love this platform. It provides an easy adaptable way of learning that fits all types of people, and meets them where they are. The videos are nicely done, where as, it is not boring. Thank you for this platform

My first time. But every step counts to my improvement. I recommend you to download and start learning. It's smartphone efficient if you are not in possession of a tablet, laptop or computer. Thanks in advance.
The video player should go to landscape mode in full screen and when you press pause, the icons on the screen should go away if you tap the screen once. Overall, nice experience so far.

This app offers flexible learning: Learn at your own pace or with a schedule‚Äîwhatever suits you best. You can earn certificates that are respected by employers and schools (for a fee). Choose from many topics like tech, business, education, and more.
No search / filter option. Chatbot may give you some recommendations but as soon as you open the first link the chat itself disappears. Waste of time.
Videos are costly. You download and save all to device to watch for later, but then require that you be online and streaming again. Now nothing plays, even online, been over a week now. CS50x
they say they offer some free classes online, explore and all have a high prices. I was excited to learn on this app.

I don't think I need to write anything about the service edX is providing, it's so helpful for me so so so helpful that I can't put it into words. I failed in my college but after learning from edX - I have a job without a degree but a job with skills.‚ù§Ô∏è I wo(uld recommend edX to everyone, no matter what occupation you have. Working professionals can use edX to upskill, students can use to learn and dive deep into subjects.

The courses are great! However, I am not able to submit my answers at all. I am only able tap the show answer button. I *can* tap an answer but the app won't let me submit it. Additionally, I have to turn on closed captions every single time I open a video. I am hard of hearing and I prefer closed captions to be displayed. Perhaps there's a way to set closed captions to always be on in settings? Another problem is that my progress is not saved and I lose track of where I am.
Great platform for someone who wants to learn a relevant skill without having much money. You learn a skill that you can actually use in real life
i think if there is a feature that gives answer of questions then this app will be best learning platform for middle class family including me :) thanks edx for free education
It's one of the greatest platforms to learn. It provides invaluable learning for free.
All good but the price that they fixed for certificates is very very high for middle class

Lots of cool variety. Too bad I'm too poor for most of them. There is no option to filter or search by cost. Ones that say they are free arent really free courses, more like "you can go through the material for free" Going at your own pace is a luxury you need to buy. Same with getting actual grades. There is also no way to bookmark courses so I can go back and decide which one I want to invest in. The AI site assistant is useless and gives me a wrong answer EVERY time.

The UX interface can be improved further. 1. I'm struggling to filter the courses that I'm currently studying, and the courses that I save for later. 2. The subtitles on handheld devices do not show when videos are put in horizontal. Conversely, it forces users to follow transcripts instead of subtitles in vertical mode Overall, the experience is okay if students need to access the materials without their PCs.

Awesome app! A lot of free courses that are really worth to spend your extra time and we can learn serious knowledge that are neded by both students and professionals. Aside from being free, another awesome part is you can do it at your own pace. But make sure to add them to your calendar because if you missed the course, you cannot take it again for free.

the courses are very good and very useful yet it seems that I have trouble with microphone access as when I try to use the microphone inside the app it doesn't work and it doesn't even show that access is needed even in the settings

If your access to a course has expired, the app provides no way to pay to get it back! What's the point of providing things in a time-limited way if you don't make it easy to pay for more time?? Edit: there's a button saying "Upgrade to access more features", but if I click it, it just tells me what that would look like. I still want to actually upgrade, and I still have no idea how!

I love EdX and I'm looking forward to using it for many months to come. The app, though, could use some updates: quizzes and exercises are hard to visualize and, therefore, to complete; there should be an option that allows you to mark the courses that interest you without having to start them immediatly: there are so many of them and I'd rather not have to screenshot every single one that I find interesting.

PLEASE BRING BACK THE PREVIOUS VERSION! Before the update, I could download the videos on the course and watch them offline, then occasionally get back online to log the progress. However, after the update, the app won't let me study offline even when I have downloaded the videos. Now, even after downloading the videos, they seems to be streaming on data given that they keep lagging, the quality of the videos is very high and there is no option to change it.

I really love the concept of the app. But I wish there was a "add to wishlist" or "interested" option for the courses so that I wouldn‚Äôt have to search for a desired course many times. I could find courses, add them to wishlist and later or I couldn see them all at one place. This way I could organise my desired courses better. Please add this feature

I really like that app. I appreciate you for letting people like me study and get great information from best universities. But! Please, don't forget to make the app better. Sometimes it crush, sometimes courses looks wrong, like half page without choice to look other half page. And add please translator into the app. Because for non-English speakers some words isn't known, like me, for example, I don't know some words, and trying to translate words is difficult. Thanks.
I honestly like studying with edx but if there's a certificate with low cost as 20 or 15 dollars. it much be better
the content is clear and simple but it is very short
This is an awesome app for learning. As of 11/9 I'm starting to have problems with the app.

How can some of the best universities release an app that does not work on a smartphone? Sure, most of it might, but I downloaded this piece of useless rubbish with the sole reason of completing an activity that was not touch screen friendly on the website. And it's still impossible to complete on a smartphone within the app. And you have the gall to include a guide on 'how to complete this exercise using keyboard only' within that same app. Like I can use keyboard shortcuts on a touchscren.

The app needs a green icon to show what classes you already studied. Similar to the website. And it also lacks the possibility of doing zoom in, similar to when you are in a call through the zoom app. Sometimes you watch the content at a little device and you just can't see everything. Thanks thanks. Pay me later ;). The content is good. The website is good. The app needs a little bit of tune and modernization.

This is a very good app and has the best courses in the world. But I would suggest a few optimisations to make this even better: There is no option for video quality and it always plays the video in HD quality, which leads to hindrance in watching videos in low network. Downloading the video doesn't help, because it downloads in low quality which is not what I want. If there was a video quality option while watching video as well as while downloading the video, I would happily give 5 stars.üòä
amazing! intuitive! and I recommend anybody looking into it to get on this platform!
It's free knowledge... Take advantage of it! Especially in places where you're forced to pay for education beyond high school.

There is one big issue with the app. When I downloaded the videos of a course. I kept seeing the same video again and again and again. The issue is not on the web app. Man I wasted a lot of data while trying to download those videos. Please fix the mobile app or show me a way I can get around it.

Edx provides some of the best online courses I've done so far. My only concern is that some of the content in some of the courses don't line up well on the phone especially with questions with drag and drop answers. Either the content lies out of view to the right or as with the drag and drop questions answers at the bottom can't be dragged into the answer place at the top.

I just started to use this app. I dunno if it's always like that when you click to some materials and they open in a browser, not in an app itself. But what's great is that the edX platform is a very serious thing. You just can't underestimate the quality. It's much much better than 80% of universities we study in. There's no extra words, actions, functions. Everything is perfectly understandable, the sentences are balanced, so far I personally haven't found any cons. Just keep it up, edX!

title: Google Keep - Notes and lists
description:
Quickly capture and share your thoughts, manage your to-dos, and stay organized. Google Keep has all of the functionality you need, with advanced security and privacy measures to keep your information safe.

Capture what‚Äôs on your mind
‚Ä¢ Inspiration strikes anywhere. Jot down a quick note, snap a photo of something you want to remember, or speak a voice memo on the go. 
‚Ä¢ Take advantage of widgets on your phone and tablet and add tiles and complications to your Wear OS device to quickly capture your thoughts.

Share ideas with friends and family
‚Ä¢ Manage your grocery list or plan your next trip by sharing your Keep notes with others and collaborating.

Find what you need, fast
‚Ä¢ Color and add labels to notes to quickly organize and get on with your life. If you need to find something you saved, a simple search will turn it up.
‚Ä¢ Pin notes to your phone or tablet homescreen with widgets and add shortcuts to your notes with tiles on a Wear OS device.

The right note at the right time
‚Ä¢ Need to remember to pick up some groceries later this week? Set a reminder to bring back your grocery list right when you need it.

Always within reach
‚Ä¢ Keep works on your phone, tablet, computer and Wear OS device. Everything syncs across all of your devices so your thoughts are always with you.
descriptionHTML:
Quickly capture and share your thoughts, manage your to-dos, and stay organized. Google Keep has all of the functionality you need, with advanced security and privacy measures to keep your information safe.

Capture what‚Äôs on your mind
‚Ä¢ Inspiration strikes anywhere. Jot down a quick note, snap a photo of something you want to remember, or speak a voice memo on the go.
‚Ä¢ Take advantage of widgets on your phone and tablet and add tiles and complications to your Wear OS device to quickly capture your thoughts.

Share ideas with friends and family
‚Ä¢ Manage your grocery list or plan your next trip by sharing your Keep notes with others and collaborating.

Find what you need, fast
‚Ä¢ Color and add labels to notes to quickly organize and get on with your life. If you need to find something you saved, a simple search will turn it up.
‚Ä¢ Pin notes to your phone or tablet homescreen with widgets and add shortcuts to your notes with tiles on a Wear OS device.

The right note at the right time
‚Ä¢ Need to remember to pick up some groceries later this week? Set a reminder to bring back your grocery list right when you need it.

Always within reach
‚Ä¢ Keep works on your phone, tablet, computer and Wear OS device. Everything syncs across all of your devices so your thoughts are always with you.
summary: Google Keep

scraped_reviews.content: Dislike how the last edited date was removed from the bottom of the note screen and is no longer quickly viewable =(. Having the date visible was so useful for being able to separate similar, recent notes based on their dates. It was also useful for tagging dates onto when you jotted something down regarding something that you've been following (stocks, games, etc) and for setting up alarms.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Kevin. We'd like our users to have the best possible experience with the Google Keep app. We'll share your feedback with our product team. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: I liked the notes better on my old phone. I don't like that when I set up a check list, my checked off items just disappear. I wish the checked items would just looked crossed through or a lighter color text. it gives a sense of accomplishment, seeing what got done, rather than worrying if I just erased my to do list (I use it daily at work so I use the same list daily)

I use this app for my grocery shopping, vision board, brainstorms, rough draft, and notes at work. It love the feature that it integrates notes on multiple devices. So if I do a note on my tablet and what to glance at it at work, I can do so on my phone with no problem. Just a quick refresh. One of the most practical apps you can have in your arsenal for organization.

I use Google Keep A LOT and have saved MANY notes over the past decade - some are quite long. So it's very frustrating when I search my notes for a specific word and it gives me all the notes that contain that word, BUT when I open each note, the word doesn't remain highlighted. That makes it VERY HARD to find. It needs to keep the searched word highlighted in each note or at least allow me to search within each of those notes again and let me jump to each highlighted occurrence in that note.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Dennis. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app very much, I use it literally EVERYDAY, but a recent update has removed the dates off of the notes ‚Äî that is not something I can accept. The dating in the notes are very important to me, I do A LOT of my own writing for my own books, and it's very handy to know when I wrote something down, not to mention the sentimental value of knowing when a note was made. You have taken away sentimental value from us!! This is such a big thing to take away from the app, that I might stop using
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Greyson. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Keep - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: Although it's not perfect, I use google keep the most because of the incredible search feature and it's simplicity. The extra step needed to start taking a note is dumb, especially since you can already do all of those things from the Text version. It's pointless. My biggest wish is that the character limit for individual notes be removed. I almost never exceed the limit, but when I do, it is a real pain! Keep it simple, but limitless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Sam. We'd like our users to have the best possible experience with the Google Keep app. We'll share your feedback with our product team. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: I like the app a lot and have used it for years. Recently however the search function appears to be broken. When trying to search for key words, the app will not show results correctly. I have tested this on various notes and the success/failure rate appears to be random. Sometimes it can't find words in the title and sometimes it can't find words in the body of the note. Other times, it finds key words correctly in either title or body. If this is fixed, I'd give the app a solid 4/5 stars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jason. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Keep - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app! The only thing I wish were different is being able to still see all original dates at the bottom of your note(s) instead of the date changing after even the smallest edit. Well, at least if you wanted the original date to stay the same, which could be an option. Also, I've "misplaced" a few notes after changing phones and reinstalling this app. However, it's one of THE best!!! Please... never add ads. Thanks! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

It's a good app but lately it keeps telling me to reload it because they've added more features. You must click on reload or snooze or the message stays there. If you click snooze, it just keeps coming back. I clicked reload and it reloaded but a day or two later, it did the same thing again. It's very annoying! It should do this within updates, when I update all my apps and not separately as it has been happening. It uses too much data.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Rebecca. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Keep - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this app for years. Suddenly, my widget stops working, so I delete it, intending to put it back, to see if it will start loading again. Then I realize the one I like is no longer available. In its place is the ability to pin only one note (instead of being able to scroll through them all) and the font is HUGE. Way bigger than the font in the note itself, with no way to change it that I can find. Please, put the old widget back, some of us relied on it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Kat, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app and have been using it for years to organize my many lists and notes. However, the voice note feature seems pretty useless. It stops recording automatically if there is even the briefest pause in speaking. I would love to use this feature for song ideas and longer recordings. As it is, I can't even talk fast enough to use for a basic note. Manual controls for the recorder would be greatly appreciated!

I've used this app for several years and loved it until the recent upgrade this month (12/24). All notes are there except the two most important lists I use weekly. They are pinned but show nothing but a white background. I have deleted the cache but no luck. I would undo the upgrade but can't find any way to do so. Very disappointing.

I have been using Keep Notes for several years and it does exactly what I need it to do. I can enter notes in text form, or a bullet list form, images.. whatever I need. I can pin the list to the top of my notes list, of which I have many, or I can drag it into any order I want. My guess is there are some tools and features I have not discovered, but suffice it to say, it's a great app. Simple and effective to use.

I have used this app for years because of its no nonsense simplicity as well as its useful features such as sorting and automatic syncing. I don't like the new update for several reasons others have stated: the extra step to creating a new note, no longer having quick & easy access to the date edited, and highly visible prompting on blank notes to use ai. Please fix this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ecila. We'd like our users to have the best possible experience with the Google Keep app. We'll share your feedback with our product team. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is basic even for a basic app. There are no font options to choose from, almost no formatting options whatsoever, no sticky notes, and I can't even sort my notes by alphabetical order! I am coming from OneNote, so what this app is lacking is obvious. The only thing better about this app is that it actually syncs (OneNote's sync function is broken). I am giving this app a star for that reason, and another star because there are at least some customization options, albeit very limited.

The main way I use Keep is by having a widget on my homescreen for a certain list/collection of notes. The only thing I find inconvenient about this (and that is missing from Keep vs other similar apps I've used) is that when creating a note from the collection widget, the note does NOT get automatically labeled as being under that collection. I have to remember to label it myself or it will not appear on the widget. Please fix this and it would be 5 stars from me!

Functions fine, I'm sad with reminders because there are only preset times that you can choose when adding a reminder for the note, but on your phone, you can do any custom time and date. Also, where are the new-looking tiles? In your images for the app, you show new colorful tiles and on my watch, my tiles show up like that but once I add them they go back to their normal kinda orange and black theme. I am on the Galaxy Watch 6 Classic.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Oliver! Could you give us some more information on the issue you are facing so that we may be of help? You can update your comment with a description of the issue. Have a great day!

scraped_reviews.content: They fixed the bug! Ever since the update to the UI, all the panes during a search were invisable when my phone was on power saving mode. Now I can see my search panes with no problem. update 2025-11-01 They ruined it. I used to be able to just create a new note by double tapping the plus icon on the bottom right. Now, it does nothing. 5* -> 1*
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tae. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Keep - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: This app used to be so much better. The boxes would collapse to a smaller size. The check list grocery list has been changed. It used to be that once I checked a box the checked ingredient would go to the top of the list. Now it stays and I have to scroll through the entire list to find the boxes that I checked.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Dan, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Good for taking quick notes when pen/paper are not available. Checklist feature very handy. Being able to share between multiple devices (phone/tablet/PC/etc.) really helpful. Ability to have multiple notes helps with organizing, wish there was a built-in way to copy/move information between the different notes.

I've used Keep Notes for years specifically because it was a light, intuitive, Note app with time and location based reminders that synced across all devices. Since the integration it is no longer light, far less intuitive, and no longer allows location based reminders. In addition, simple customization features, such as setting custom times for morning, afternoon, evening, etc are gone. I also dislike my calendar being cluttered with reminders from Keep.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Michael, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: This is one of my favorite Apps! I use it for my shopping list all the time. You can check ‚úîÔ∏è items off as you shop. Also, add numerous photos. I love being able to move my favorite notes so they're at the top. And, you may archive old notes so you may keep them but don't have them taking up space. Ooh, plus, you may color-code each note. I save everything I feel is important to this App. You may also share notes to anyone with the App!

Besides completely generic, never updated update descriptions, the recent change to forcing use of calendar or tasks for Keep notifications is for the birds. I don't want to use a separate app just for the notifications. The usefulness of the app has just about tanked since that change. I used to use Keep reminders regularly, now I strongly dislike using them. Please put it back the way it was or I will be looking for a different app that doesn't need a separate app for reminders. Lame move G!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Brian. We'd like our users to have the best possible experience with the Google Keep app. We'll share your feedback with our product team. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: I use this for everything - from grocery list to breakup notes, it's handy and easy to sort, you can color code and pin the most important ones. I just wish they enabled the option to be able to have free text with the checkbox option in the same note instead of having to make everything checkbox.

I use this app for life, both work and personal. The only downside for me is there is a limit to the max size a note can be. As a result, I still use OneNote for any notes that I expect to cross that limit. I would love for them to remove this limitation because I would make it my sole note taking app. Also, I love the new formatting options. Keep the updates coming!

Keeps getting slower, keeps getting "features" that dilute what used to be quick and handy. You can't even start a note now without first navigating a choice of styles. Let me choose a default! I only ever want text! I've used it for years but I'm starting to look at alternatives.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Keep - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: I like it. I love that it connects to the Google account for easy syncing across apps, BUT a big need for me is making categories out of my list. for example, I created a shopping list, but there's no way for me to group items by category or shopping section (i.e., dairy, meats, pantry, clothes, cleaning, etc.). It would make this app perfect for me as well as many others, I'm sure.

What is a notes app supposed to do? Take notes of course. I don't need AI help. I don't want it. I am more than happy to jump through 20 hoops to disable it. There is no such option. It only became an issue when it started deleting what I write (even though I have autocorrect and all that turned off). I quite literally went through every option. 30 minutes or so of settings scrolling just to disable a stupid pop up. keep notes should just... keep notes. haha.

I've been using Keep Notes for at least 6 years and as long as Google supports the app and updates it, I'll continue to use it. It's handy for everything from journals to grocery lists. You can even send documents to Google Docs for printing. Everything is backed up and saved in the cloud so when you change devices, everything is still there. you can also access your Notes from all your devices at the same time. When I'm journaling I like to use my Chromebook because I can type faster on it.

Simple, organized, accessible notes app. Does its job, and pretty well at that. Nothing overly special, just colors, labels, basic formatting, and Google's sync functionality. Honestly, could use more powerful features; lists can only have two "layers", there are limited colors to choose from, etc. If this app were updated to be just a bit more powerful it would be perfect.

Absolutely hands down, the best note app for many reasons, but the main reason for me is this: I can write the title of a product I'm researching inside the note. Then copy and paste a link to the website of the product. Then just like magic, the note will show the product title and a thumbnail picture. Sounds simple because it is ! Unfortunately even Samsung Notes don't do that. If this app had a price tag, I would gladly purchase it.

I was trying to switch to using this instead of samsung notes so I could have my notes consolidated BUT this app has such sad functionality. if I want to have a drawing, a checklist, and an image on the same note, you just cant. You cant make folders, only tags which isn't the same. You also cannot lock any notes down. Overall, very limited and pretty disappointing coming from Google.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Keerah. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Keep - Storage & cache - Clear cache. Also, we'll pass on your feedback to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I over use this app so much. Fast convenient versatile. You're not gonna use it to write a thesis but quick notes or when you need to save a URL or picture for some reason and want to give it context, it's nice to be able to pop the link in make a few notes and come back to it when you need it later. The best feature aside from ease of use is you sync to your account so if you're on your phone and need to swap to your computer you don't have to do it in Google docs/drive just type and go.

The lack of the ability to lock notes is a big deal breaker for me. I sometimes like to write personal things in my notes app as a sort of journal, or write down passwords so I don't forget them, and not being able to lock those notes is very agitating. especially since pretty much every other native notes app for other phones has this feature. I think it should be implemented in a near-future update, and if so my rating would rise to 5 stars immediately.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tyler. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within the Google Keep app: Menu (3 lines, Top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Everyone should have this or similar app. We use it as a shopping list (mostly). We add items (often while cooking) to the list with our Google home devices, then open the app while at the grocery store. I prefer the Alexa shopping list, but since we have more Google Home devices (cameras, thermostats, lighting, and speakers), it makes sense to use just one assistant.

Google keep is a great tool, however there are some basic functionality that you would expect from an app that supposed to be the standard. the audio recording stops every time you stopped speaking, completely impractical for recording songs, or anything where there might be a slight pause. I also find it very frustrating to go to my unpinned notes, there seems to be no way to get to the unpinned notes quickly, in no way to pin the notes immediately upon sharing something into the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Kaison, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I put non telephone numbers into my notes to keep track of things. even though they're clearly not phone numbers, the formatting keeps changing them to phone numbers automatically and there's no way to prevent this from happening beyond changing how I want to format the numbers in my notes. I thought Google was the company of customization. Please put something in the settings that allows you to stop this from happening.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: For the most part I enjoy the app. I like being able to have access to it wherever I am and whatever device I'm on. My cons, when changing view of notes would like to be able to see only the title. >Spell check while writing. >Be able to sort by color, alphabetically, by created time or modified time, by list, detailed list. >In checklist I want to be able to order items alphabetically.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alicia. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Simple but versatile interface. Lacks the ability to sort lists (e.g. alphabetically), which is a severe shortcoming. Search function is useless if your notes are longer than a few lines, because the results will be off screen and not scrollable. Drawing on images is tedious--lots of steps required to change pen style/color/transparency, and settings are discarded by app after every use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Much improved. Now Google Keep can set reminders not only based on times and dates, but also locations. It's nice to say "remind me when I return home to check the camera footage" or whatever it may be. You can even input other locations/ addresses and it'll work that way. Gemini can't even do that haha! And it's "AI"... artificially incompetent..

Keep is simple and reliable... but actually too simple. It needs a feature to alphabetize the contents of a list. And searching the contents of a note to locate a word within it is a basic trivial function which is also missing. Collaboration is good... nice and flexible to be able to share a note with anyone, and/or with one's family group... that's why I still use this despite its glaring shortcomings.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi David. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Why the voice notes? You can just dictate right from your keyboard. If you want the audio recording, the quality is so horrible you're much better off recording in your regular messaging app (if sending to someone), or use Voice Recorder, Samsung Notes or any other app that don't record like one of those cheap plastic toys that once came in cereal boxes. Need way better colors in dark mode too. Maybe option for note outline color? Font colors? Still my go-to for Android, Apple &PC though!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. To create folders in Google Keep, we suggest you to follow the steps listed in this article: https://goo.gle/3Uk6Gf1. Also, we'll pass your feedback along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: The Search option for inside note will be useful as feeding a lengthy and important notes makes this app useful. But finding a particular words or line with the help of search option would have been really convenient. Like pdf, word or other documents have, for example. My last post was a year ago, but I still haven't seen any changes to it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Sam, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I had given a 3 star ratings moments ago, then hit the update after. It would seem my initial installation had issues which is why the labels weren't working in organising (grouping) my files. After the update, it works well and now it gets its full 5 stars. No need for a folder since the Labels actually do the job in grouping the tagged files. That said, I'd appreciate more organisation options concerning the order (Date added, Modified, Alphabetical) It's only doing modified for now I think.

One of my most used apps, it works well for simple lists, shopping lists and the odd doodle. The widgets need to include a button to take you to your list of notes - I have to tap the new note button, then go back to find my existing notes and I can't see a way around it. please include this in your widget.

Ever since I updated this app, it's been intensely freezing and abruptly shutting down. I can't use this for even a minute before something goes wrong. I've refreshed, emptied cache, updated, and synced my account; literally nothing has worked to stop these freezes and crashes. There are times where I go to open a past note I've written, and it's just blank‚Äîliterally nothing shows up. This is currently unusable, whether I touch the screen or not. Please fix this, this is completely terrible!!!

App is really simple to use, but it could be so much better. Needs to have password protection as an option, or a locked folder like Google Photos as I dont want all of them readily accessible - the only current option seems to be archive it to hide it from feed. Needs to have more formatting options. Need to be able to view multiple labels at once, not just one. Needs to be able to have a view where it's just the title only no note preview Would love to have the ability to add tables to notes.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Shae. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within the Google Keep app: Menu (3 lines, Top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback. Appreciate it.

scraped_reviews.content: It's called keep notes, not keep drawings. I used to love this app. Simple, quick and easy. Now they added more stuff and instead of just pressing + to create a new note, I then have to choose what it is for. It's to keep a note! I don't care if it's one more click, don't give me more work for something it was not what I installed the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Daniel, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I do really love this app. I use it a lot. My main reason for giving it 3 stars is that It still does not have any kind of active pen support in its drawing mode. If trying to use an spen on a Samsung phone, or some other stylus, it doesn't give you any of the features supported by the pen such as the option to click the button while drawing to erase. There is no option to switch to any kind of pen-only mode. Feels like an important feature, especially with forum posts requesting it since 2016.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Doug, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: A really good Notes app. It's storage size doesn't knock at your file's bin's door as a daily reminder to loosen up some space. One thing I really-really wish it has is a folder feature (also text colors) to help us organize TONS of notes. I experience some lag issues when typing texts - it might be caused by multiple notes in the background. If it's somehow every notes I stash is not loaded, it might cause the lag to go. Petition for a folders feature (instead of single-use labels). üñêÔ∏è
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Keep - Storage & cache - Clear cache. Also, we'll share your feedback with our product team. Thanks!

title: MyRadar Weather Radar
description:
MyRadar is a fast, easy-to-use, yet powerful weather app that displays animated weather radar around your current location, allowing you to quickly see what weather is coming your way. Just start the app, and your location pops up with animated live radar, with radar loop lengths of up to two hours.  This basic functionality provides the quickest way to get a fast snapshot of the weather on-the-go, and it's what has made MyRadar so successful over the years.  Check your phone and get an instant assessment of the weather that will impact your day.

In addition to the live radar, MyRadar has an ever-increasing list of weather and environmentally-related data layers that you can overlay on top of the map;  our animated winds layer shows a breathtaking visual representation of both surface winds and winds at the jetstream level; the frontal boundaries layer shows high and low pressure systems as well as frontal boundaries themselves; the earthquakes layer is a great way to stay on top of the latest reports on seismic activity, completely customizable as to severity and time; our hurricane layer allows users to stay on top of the latest tropical storm and hurricane activity throughout the world; the aviation layer overlays AIRMETs, SIGMETs and other aviation-related data, including the ability to track flights and display their IFR flight plans and paths, and the "wildfires" layer allows users to stay abreast of the latest fire activity around the United States.

In addition to the data layers, MyRadar has the ability to send weather and environmental alerts, including alerts from the National Weather Center, such as Tornado and Severe Weather alerts.  MyRadar includes the ability to receive alerts based off of Tropical  Storm and Hurricane activity;  you can configure the app to send you an alert any time a tropical storm or hurricane forms, or is upgraded or downgraded.

One of the most useful features in MyRadar is the ability to provide advanced rain alerts;  our patent-pending process for predicting hyper-local rainfall is the most accurate in the industry.  Instead of having to constantly check the app, MyRadar will send you an alert up to an hour in advance as to when the rain will arrive at your current location, down to the minute, including details on intensity and duration.  These alerts can be a life saver when you're on-the-go and don't always have time to check the weather - our systems will proactively do the work for you and let you know in advance before the rain hits.

All of the weather and environmental data represented on MyRadar is displayed on our custom mapping system, developed in-house.  This mapping system uses your devices GPU, which makes it incredibly fast and speedy. The map has the standard pinch/zoom capability which allows you to smoothly zoom and pan around the United States and the rest of the world to see what the weather is like anywhere on the planet.

In addition to the free features of the app, the premium upgrade is available, including real-time hurricane tracking - great for the start of hurricane season.  This feature provides additional data above and beyond the free version, including the cone of probability for tropical storm/hurricane forecast tracks, and also includes a detailed synopsis from the National Hurricane Center.  The premium upgrade also include the professional radar pack, which allows greater detail of radar from individual stations.  Users can select individual radar stations around the US, select the radar tilt angle, and also change the radar product being displayed, including base reflectivity and wind velocity - great for experienced weather buffs looks to stay on top of possible tornado formation.

MyRadar is also available for Wear OS devices, including tiles for both radar and current conditions - try on your smartwatch!

Don't get caught off guard with bad weather;  download MyRadar today and try it out!
