summary: Hyperlocal rain alerts by MyRadar using patent-pending technology, radar & more

scraped_reviews.content: When all of the radar in the weather apps are stuck not updating, MyRadar is still working. With the addition of the ability to manually scroll through the snapshots manually this gets 5 stars in my book. I wish i the snapshots were closer to up to date than 5 minutes old, but it's so useful already, so that gets a "that's life" response... It's come so far in 10 years, it's great!

I have the paid version of the app. I really enjoyed it for a year and a half and was impressed with it's accuracy. Unfortunately, over the last 6 months it's quality and accuracy has notably dropped. Temperatures are wrong, the app seems to follow the "model" by default rather than actual weather conditions, and when the weather is unpredictable it cannot handle the change. Right now, the temperature is in the high 50/low 60s but the app is insisting it is mid-70s despite multiple restarts.

One of the best weather apps I have tried. Very good for daily and minute to minute forecasts, including alerts like "rain in 10 minutes." The radar layers are comprehensive and adjustable. Severe weather alerts and plots manageable with extra adjustments. I have not responded to the "invest in our company" advertising, but I can understand why it might be compelling.

MyRadar is an awesome radar app. It also shows you the actual current weather conditions like any other weather app depending on where you point the radar at. It's also pretty fast too, loading faster than the other weather radar apps I have. It's great if you need a quick peek if it's gonna rain soon and ot also sends you alerts if there's severe weather in the next few hours.

Love this app! So much so that I got the paid version to support the creators. I live in South Florida and it's important to know where the random storms are. A few times during our hurricane season, this app was the first to alert me that we were in the "cone of concern". They are quick to fix problems that come up when Android releases new versions and that can be rare these days. I installed it on all my family's devices and they're loving it too. All my thanks to this team!

In regards to the app itself, it does an overall good job. I have noticed that the radar over open waters (not close to shore) is highly overblown. I live near the coast and venture into our local mountains often, so this issue is something I have to account for regularly. However, my biggest concern is the nasty nature of the advertising. Very sexually explicit and gross. I find myself at a crossroad of not wanting to support a company which allows perverse adds by paying for the pro version.

I have had this app for 9 years! Simply the Best! - This is by far the absolute best radar app you can get. No frills just exactly what you want. Super super easy to use. Has some extra options for purchase like hurricane updates..which for me living in the gulf was a nice little addition. I have found practiclly zero lag in its accuracy. Also will give you notification of impending bad weather..you do have to turn notifications "on". Try it for yourself.

Been using this for years. I am poor and use a bike to get around. The weather apps I use are very important and I take them seriously. This is by far the best I have found. I use the free version because I'm poor. Still hands down the best. I have no issues with ads. if I had money I would purchase full version because its that good. live radar, satellite and hi-def views available. Forecasts are very accurate almost down to the minute. Often I will time rain stopping or starting before leaving

I find this to be quite a good app so far. There are two things I would love to have added, rainfall and snowfall totals, please. Update 11.11.25: the way snow is shown on the radar isn't okay. Why do you show it as satellite cloud cover? that done really show how heavy the precipitation is. When you love in an area that gets a lot of snow this style of radar is useless. This is why I have reduced my review to 2 stars.

Living in a mountainous area, weather can be really tricky. Weather apps tend to give me what is going to happen in the closest city to me but it's a good 20 miles from me! My Radar is the only app that can consistently give me the best weather prediction for wherever I am. There are plenty of choices to help me tailor the app to what I need, and that's just the free version. We have come to depend on this app over many others.

Does exactly as described. Great app. Ads are not intrusive like some of the other weather apps I've tried. I have the free version and it has everything that I and most folks will ever need. The radar is right on point and the forecast is about as accurate as one could expect, even the ten day. I'm going to keep this one and hope that they don't change things up.

App really is perfect for traveling in any area. You can determine with good accuracy what the weather is like ahead on a trip, and it shows what is happening where you are. Was on a trip and it showed severe weather ahead and we had to go through it. What ever level it showed at the point of the storm was exactly right. Good news that we knew the end of it was close. I use the wind direction function, which is very good to know. More features not mentioned. Really recommend app.

Very good app. I have been using it for years now. Very accurate and easy to use. It has every setting you need or want. Different kinds of layers you can apply for wind, clouds, rain,lightning, fires, atmospheric highs and lows. Also, a one time cheap yearly subscription to get everything to become your own meteorologist. Highly recommend.

I find that the app does not update fast enough. The app is always around 15mins behind. I also use another app called Zoom Earth that tracks weather 1 hour ahead of time. This is what people need to help them make the right decision in there area. Zoom is also cheaper per year by quit a bit. I recommend you check them out. I am thinking about dropping this app because I like to know in advance of what's going on in my area.

Despite this app being my go to for weather related info for many years as a tour rider, it has its limitations unless you buy into it. I never needed all the bells and whistles paying would get me because the basic app provides what is important to me. That said it would be great if the basic app could refresh in real time. Seems it's always 15 minutes or so behind what is happening on the ground. so for that reason I rated it good, but not perfect.

I use the app all the time - daily, sometimes several times per day if the weather is changing. I can watch the severity and intensity of an approaching weather system, check temperature, humidity levels, wind strength and direction and much more. I like being able to focus in on my position as well as to expand out for hundreds of miles if necessary to be aware of approaching weather systems.

As a Sealcoater, and an Asphalt man, knowing what the weather is going to do is important. I use multiple apps and cross references, but one of the most reliable everytime has been MyRadar. I'm not sure if there is a way for it to do future weather predictions, but that is the only recommended 'critique' would be, if you'd want to call it that. Strongly Recommend.

Notification issues. I've asked the app to only send me notifications on severe weather in my area. but i get a 24/7 notification that i cannot turn off without turning off all notifications, including the ones i actually want.. very frustrating as i have to use a completely different app for notifications. otherwise i like this app. i find its pretty consistent to others and like the features.

I have been using the app since 2018, and for the most part it has been really good. There are a few things that I don't like such as not getting weather alerts during severe weather. It has been better lately but that has been an issue. Other than that and sometimes the weather boxes are not the right color (flash flood being red and not green) the app is great. So four stars but it really deserves five.

This used to be a 5 star app. But now I need to redo the setup location and notification permissions every single time I open it (as of about 2 weeks ago). My phone keeps all of the settings, it's only the app that forgets them. I'll still use it because there isn't a better free radar app out there that I've found, but it is useless for weather notifications now.

I have used this application for a few years and it's my first choice to see what to expect in the weather of the day. I will look at other apps also to compare so I get the most accurate forecast. The graphics of MyWeather Radar are better than those other available radar apps. It's easy to move the crosshairs to a location and the info comes up quickly and to the point.

I have been using this app daily for 7 or 8 years. It is reliable, accurate and gives me good radar by the hour, day or week: rainfall, temp, wind and cloud coverage forecasts. The weather dashboard at the top of the page of this app gives you a quick view of the day and a snapshot of the the next 2 days. Grab the pulldown bar and the next week day by day forecast is there. I like the radar sweep and radar tracking of storms. You can pin your favorite places to monitor weather, too.

Handsdown the best weather RADAR app (I use many weather apps simultaneously & compare them daily). I do not find MyRadar's hourly local weather predictions to be terribly accurate, however. They seem to always be a bit slow or 'off' a few degrees. However if you want to know when the rain or snow will be arriving & want to see it in real time on a radar screen approaching, this app is IT. Worth the money without ads? They need to up their game in non-graphical reporting. Hence 4/5.

I use this app so frequently. I can typically gauge how much time I have before the rain starts by zooming out, seeing the speed and direction of the storm. It is very useful for short notice planning, like whether or not to wait it out or pack it up and go. I live on the Front Range of CO, so the weather is pretty unpredictable.

easy to use , graphics are Good and update isn't prefect timing but, is really really close. Also during storm season sometimes you can see Hook echo has its forming with high winds and even rain wrapped or building up. So this app is Best that is out there. Also you can pick what your looking for, wind rain Cloud cover (Fog). If it has Lighting Strikes I don't use it. I also keep it on Dark Mode 24/7. Track Storms and Rain in real time.

this radar app does what it is supposed to do... it shows the radar! it doesn't run ads in the way, and it has great layer options for multiple weather categories. Cloud cover, winds, warnings, and outlooks, along with many other options, can be turned on or off at any time. Radar and temps on a global scale!

Best weather app on the net! Tons of features and yet easy to use. Has a beautiful screen and the ability to check weather anywhere on the planet quickly! Just pinch and go anywhere, it's very cool to just play with, really. Or you can zoom down to street level. 7 day accurate forecast by pulling down on the forecast screen. Lots of info in a well laid out presentation and is not overwhelming. They even offer an pre-ipo long term investment opportunity at a reasonable price. Pilots love it!

Best Weather app in the play store, fully functional radar is included in the free version. The minimal ads are unobtrusive, practically unnoticeable compared to most of the "free" apps. For a small fee, don't recall if it's a one-time or subscription, you get access to more specialized radar stuff, like flight paths and Hurricanes. Because of the multitude of options, it can be a little overwhelming getting it all setup but if you take your time you will end up with an amazing weather radar app

I've paid for the ad free version of this for years, as has my husband. Over the last several months, we've both noticed less accuracy with the radar. August 1st, I downloaded 2 more radar apps and compared all of them over the last week and a half of mostly rainy days. Both of the new apps are more accurate and both are free. Today, I've deleted this app. An inaccurate radar is useless.

Sometimes ads and requests for investors are obtrusive, but overall, this is my go-to app when I want to see the future, weather-wise. clean radar picture, easy centering on my location, lots of options on what you want to display. Might want to make the lightning strike option easier to find. its in the settings for high-def radar, but it's NOT intuitive to find, also, just recently, versions displayed lightning as a zigzag bolt, and it was easy to locate. Now it's not as good. Change it back!

more accurate than many others. Lots of free features but I like the upgraded version for hurricane tracking since I live in Florida. You can add layers too to see wind, road weather, temperature, forecast, fronts, etc but if you apply too many layers you can no longer see the radar. Not a fan that they added ads. It should be ad-free especially if paying.

I've been using this this app for at least 2 years. It's accurate, easy to use, and has never crashed. You can toggle through the forecast and see temperature, wind speed, cloudy vs. sunny, and percentage chance of rain. I also like that I can choose to get a notification if it's going to rain and choose a specific intensity of rain that I want to be notified about. For example, I can choose drizzle, light rain, heavy rain, etc. The ads aren't intrusive and annoying. I love the live radar too!

I have used this app for years. One of the things I like most about it is that it gives you the radar in real time so you can see at its base, the core data our weather sources are reading from. In other words, it's like having a weather service station on your phone without being beholden to waiting for traffic and weather on the radio, or waiting through countless commercials on TV. It's "to the point" access, & that's what I like about it.

really great radar weather app. does everything you expect and more. I found it to be very accurate. it has ads but. they're banner ads and not obtrusive. you can subscribe to the app for $3.99 a month or $29.99 a year for ad free/more features. the free version suffices for me. however, if you can swing the $, it's well worth the subscription. highly recommended.

This is my go-to weather app because I can get everything I need to know in one place quickly. I can see the radar, so I know what's coming and how bad what's here is. The app also sends me texts for weather watches and warnings. It's easy to use and works even on older, slower phones. You have e a choice of a paid or free version. I can't afford the paid version but I can get the information I need for free without being constantly hassled to buy. Best weather app out there!!

It is absolutely great!!! When Google weather tries to start sending "stuff," I disable it. I checked out The National Weather Service app, it's so archaic. MyRadar is so neat! You can zoom in and out, move it to someplace else you want to see what the weather is doing or check out what the weather is doing where a relative or friend lives or is visiting. There are so many different informational choices to turn on or off and types of information or screens to switch to. An info packed app!!!

It has been my go-to for 4 years, It is great for immediate and short term weather forecast. It's great about warning you when rain is 10-15 away. There are many indepth feature I haven't used, but its great if you work outdoors, driving long distance, even pilots. There so many feature like lighting tracker that work great for sports and swimming. I find it more reliable than any weather app, especially with short term forecasts.

Best weather app I have used as far as accuracy of data and details. Still deserves 5 stars, but the UI seems a bit dated, stale and not very "pretty". I honestly don't care about the UI as much as the data, but I know some people do. If you just want to know the temperature and chance of rain, any other app will get it done. if you really want to follow, track and understand the weather... this is the one for you. By far the most accurate radars I have seen.

For me, it's the fastest, most comprehensive, and the most detail orientated weather app out there. Period. It's always updating radar imaging and info. I feel that MyRadar is far more in tune with the need for easy navigation throughout their app than other apps. Along with that, the amount of all the features and their ease of use is really sweet! I've bragged about MyRadar for years and shall continue with that.

it's extremely comprehensive for the average user. it's a little unconventional in that not everything you look at does something when tapped. no links or extra menus that route from one page to another. so, it's easy to use. still waiting to see how accurate it is, but so far looks great.

The app is easy to set up and navigate. I like the layers that can be added. I would suggest to make things easier that the scroll feature be put back to zoom in and out and an option to show the cities. An audio option would be fantastic to alert those of us who have storms come through in the middle of the night or to alert us with audio if we are working on our laptop. What about adding a Base velocity radar for those who are serious weather spotters?

I'm pretty sure I downloaded the app when it launched on the playstore for exterior painting (cant paint in rain). My boss was fascinated by how accurate the timing of the rain was, and we made more money that year. When the hurricane feature was available, I bought it immediately(born & raised in Florida). I found out later that the ISS was tracked on the app, too! Now, they are launching a satellite as well, and I can only imagine what's next.

MyRadar is a great app especially if you work outside. It notifies almost to the minute when it's going to rain and when it will likely stop. The only thing I've had a problem with lately is finding my current location and says 'null' instead of the city I'm in. Also it refreshes every couple seconds so I can't scroll down for the details but once it does it works better than any other weather app I've tried in the past! I would have given it 5 stars but the lagging refresh takes away from that.

Presents accurate conditions & forecasts in easy to understand graphics. Covers the entire globe... if I want the weather in Irkutsk or Lisbon, I've got it. Lots of adjustability - I can make screens show what I choose and adjust layers for visibility. It even tracks earthquake and volcano activity. Premium version has many more options (I don't have or need).

I completed an Air Force career maintaining weather equipment, and this is the app I keep on my phone all the time. it was very important during the last few hurricanes In central Florida. HOWEVER... 10 minute delay or latency is a bit much when you're living in convective conditions with potential for tornadoes. Accuweather's radar on their app manages five minute latency. I do not know what it takes to overcome this, but I wish you guys could speed it up..?

Been my favorite go to app and always will be. Actually worth the annual subscription! And I used the free version for YEARS, plenty of features there. Small, not obnoxious ads in the app on free version, didn't even notice they were there. No constant berating to subscribe or anything. Just a lot of love from whoever made this app and worked on it and it shows.

Very good, mostly. I use this, obviously, as the app. But I'm most excited about using this with Android Auto on my Gold Wing. It's amazing! (... eventually) The only issue is that it doesn't like to start up - it takes a "process" with button presses on the bike, then screen touches on the phone, back and forth ... It always works, quite well, it's just cumbersome and annoying. UPDATE: startup got easier! until ... now no longer works in Android Auto??

BEST OUT THERE! Best radar app available, and pretty good for other weather and forecast info. I'm an airline pilot, and this app is what I've been using for years to get a detailed view of what and where the weather is and what it's doing. I've tried other ones, and just plain and simple, nothing beats this app for radar. well worth the price too for the premium and hurricane tracker add ons.

I'm impressed with this radar presentation. It does strictly"radar", little other data. The "winds" feature is great. Other data would make this app like so many others, confusing! July 2025 Still using My radar. Many features have been added to the display to include a wide selection of items. Have not found any other available weather radar with a better display.

This is my favorite free weather radar App and I have been using it for about 6 years now. The app shows composite radar information from all US weather radar stations. It has many different, very useful informational overlays (such as counties affected by power outage, smoke, wind direction, temperatures, and several more options). Earlier versions of this App used to crash but, that is no longer an issue. My only gripe is about a 10 minute delay in radar info.

title: Ground News
description:
Get all your news in one place on an eye-opening platform that shows you the bias, reliability and ownership of every source you read. Cut through the noise and escape media echo chambers with Ground News.

Ground News is the largest news aggregator in the world with over 50K news sources and 60K articles added daily. But we aren‚Äôt a typical news aggregator, throwing hundreds of headlines at you that barely skim the surface. Ground frees people from algorithmic restraints, illuminates blindspots and makes media bias explicit with our one-of-a-kind media analysis features.

> Avoid manipulative algorithms
> Spot media bias
> Discover news Blindspots
> Check the reliability of sources
> See who owns the news you consume

Read daily breaking stories from sources around the world, in real time. Like a modern day newspaper, we show you diverse stories instead of algorithm-driven content that can limit your worldview. News coverage is rarely unbiased, so we give you as much context as possible so you can come to your own conclusions. Compare coverage on partisan topics like politics, and elections.

Enjoy our free features, or subscribe for in-depth analysis that will transform the way you look at news.


About Your Ground News Subscription: 
Subscriptions renew monthly and can be managed through your Play Store account
Payment will be charged to your Play Store Account on confirmation of purchase
Renewal is automatic unless turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period

See full terms and conditions here: https://ground.news/terms-and-conditions
descriptionHTML:
Get all your news in one place on an eye-opening platform that shows you the bias, reliability and ownership of every source you read. Cut through the noise and escape media echo chambers with Ground News.

Ground News is the largest news aggregator in the world with over 50K news sources and 60K articles added daily. But we aren‚Äôt a typical news aggregator, throwing hundreds of headlines at you that barely skim the surface. Ground frees people from algorithmic restraints, illuminates blindspots and makes media bias explicit with our one-of-a-kind media analysis features.

> Avoid manipulative algorithms
> Spot media bias
> Discover news Blindspots
> Check the reliability of sources
> See who owns the news you consume

Read daily breaking stories from sources around the world, in real time. Like a modern day newspaper, we show you diverse stories instead of algorithm-driven content that can limit your worldview. News coverage is rarely unbiased, so we give you as much context as possible so you can come to your own conclusions. Compare coverage on partisan topics like politics, and elections.

Enjoy our free features, or subscribe for in-depth analysis that will transform the way you look at news.


About Your Ground News Subscription:
Subscriptions renew monthly and can be managed through your Play Store account
Payment will be charged to your Play Store Account on confirmation of purchase
Renewal is automatic unless turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period

See full terms and conditions here: https://ground.news/terms-and-conditions
summary: See every side of every story

scraped_reviews.content: The app always says "Something Went Wrong" and doesn't load. I recommend using the website, which is still up. Hopefully the bug in the app will be fixed, and I am thankful the website is still working. Edit: Deleting and reinstalling the app fixed the issue! I'll leave this up in case anyone else has the same thing happen.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi LD, thanks for your updated review, I'm glad to hear deleting and reinstalling resolved the issue! Please don't hesitate to let us know if any other issues arise.

scraped_reviews.content: has full bias coverage and all the important headlines, the free version works very well (no ads, just less features) but I got the $10 yrly subscription and love it. it also doesn't encourage "the scroll" like other apps; you get on, you read what's happening today and thats it, there's the bottom of the page. it makes me feel like I'm not wasting time while also staying informed. 11/10, 6 stars if I could
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks very much for your 5 (almost 6) star review! I'm very pleased to hear you're finding the app is a great resource. We look forward to continuing to improve the service and we greatly appreciate your support.

scraped_reviews.content: I thought I would enjoy a right, left, or center based news app, this one is hard to navigate, the ads and articles they push to you are mostly subscription based unless you pay for "their" subscription. The overridden ads on every article are annoying and having it asking me every time I enter to subscribe is quite unnerving. I'll be moving on to my browser where I can control the ads I see, or never see, and I can pick which sites I want. Trying to push notifications on my phoneü§¶ is another -
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jeremiah, we're sorry to hear about your experience. I can confirm we only send push notifications to your device if you have them turned on. You can also use our external browser to improve your experience with any external sources' ads. I hope this helps!

scraped_reviews.content: The app functions, but the bias and factuality breakdowns are AI generated, hard to verify, and frequently not present at all. It aggregates articles, but it's kind of hard to tell how the algorithm decides which ones to include, because a quick web search will often turn up sites it didn't mention. It doesn't so much make it easier to find and be sure of facts as it provides access to and summarizes opinions and non-news that I was trying to avoid in the first place.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alison, we're sorry to hear about your experience. I can confirm the bias and factuality ratings are not generated by AI, they are from independent organizations. You can read more about this here: https://ground.news/rating-system If there are any missing stories on our service, please email us at feedback@ground.news so we can review this.

scraped_reviews.content: great tool. would love to use it more, but it slips my mind. one thing that might work would be if the app had like an auto-podcast system. let me specify some rules for generating a playlist, and a Text-to-Speech voice reads off the summary before playing the next item in the list. During play, have a quick-flag option to indicate I want to investigate that story more. This is a feature I could quickly get caught up on what's going on and then look forward to getting more details on later.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Aaron, thanks for your positive review and suggestion! We appreciate your ideas and have shared this with the wider team. If you think of anything else we could do to improve your experience, please don't hesitate to let us know at feedback@ground.news .

scraped_reviews.content: Claims to be transparent about the news but they sure aren't transparent about their subscription costs. You won't find the cost in the app, you have to go to the site to find out there are three tiers, and if you accept the trial, you're on the hook for the middle tier at $29.99/year. The cost doesn't bother me but not putting the subscription costs is a deal breaker.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andrew, we're sorry to hear about your experience! You should definitely see the pricing in the app when you click Profile > Manage Account > Subscribe. If you aren't, please email us any screenshots to feedback@ground.news and we're happy to investigate this further.

scraped_reviews.content: Entirely useless. I have a subscription that I've been using on a browser with no problems at all, yet this pointless app won't log in. I enter the credentials and get the whirly circle that never stops. When I tried the free sample just to get it to start, there is no way to enter credentials from within the app. Don't bother with this, use Brave or Librewolf browsers to access, and kill ads at the same time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Adam, we were previously aware of an issue affecting some Google accounts on our app where the sign-in process would get stuck on a continuous spinning symbol. Our development team has now released a fix. If you're still experiencing problems, please try reinstalling the app to the latest version and reach out to us at feedback@ground.news

scraped_reviews.content: In general a great app! And even using the free version is fantastic and I learn a lot of news that I wouldn't have learned without this app. The only thing that frustrates me is that the app seems to have this bug where it automatically unsaves my stories for later and its ones that I knew for a fact that I saved and didn't unsave. Please fix this issue
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Physically, thanks for your review and I'm glad to hear you're enjoying the service. Could you email us with details about the saved stories issue you're experiencing at feedback@ground.news ? We'd like to investigate this further.

scraped_reviews.content: it's a pretty useful app in times like these, but there's two criticisms I have. the right being blue and the left being red really messes with my brain, since it's the other way around in america. Also, I don't know if the app filters out AI articles, and since it isn't stated, I'm going to assume nope. filtering out AI articlez is something that will become increasingly important as AI progresses.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, our bias bar is designed to represent the political party associations, depending on your edition. In the UK, Canada, and Australia, the left-leaning parties are associated with red, and the right-leaning parties are associated with blue. Please follow the steps in our Help Center article "My bias bar colors are wrong" to change your edition

scraped_reviews.content: Due to a login error on Ground News end, I did not have access to my account for the first two months of my subscription. I reached out and requested a refund, but was only offered a login solution months later, never directly responding to my request for a refund. My emails to support clearly demonstrate their lack of responsiveness. The idea of this app is incredibly compelling, but implementation and customer support is very poor.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jeremiah, we're sorry to hear about your experience. This is not intentional on our parts and we want to ensure that you have access to your subscription first as it is our top priority. However, if you feel that refund is the best option for you, please don't hesitate to let our team know and we'll promptly resolve this issue.

scraped_reviews.content: Watched a YouTube ad and then went through the sign-up process before anything was mentioned about a paid subscription to unlock all the features. It's in the fine print, but they definitely try to trick people into downloading the app before discovering it. If they were honest up front and offered a free trial, I may have subscribed. It's actually a decent app. However, tricking people just like the media companies they are exposing is a dirty trick. For that reason alone, it deserves 0 stars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are a small team of 11 and Ground's existence depends on our subscribers. We appreciate our users and certainly don't intend to be deceptive. We'd love to hear how we could have made the subscription option clearer. Users can absolutely have a free trial - I can help you set one up personally if you contact us at feedback@ground.news.

scraped_reviews.content: Exceptionally valuable, I use a few different new apps, but ground news is my favorite. It gives me articles I might miss, I can read right, left, and center articles to determine what is fact, what is opinion, and and shouldn't even be considered. The small subscription fee is underselling it, but I am glad for the costs to deliver such a great service.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your delightful review, Luke! We're so happy to hear that Ground News is your favourite news app! We appreciate your testimonial and thanks for your support.

scraped_reviews.content: My favorite news app, good for keeping things clear as things continue to go sideways here in the US. If I could make a request to the team though: it would be nice if we could set more than one location for "local" news. I'm a college student studying far from home, and it would be nice to be able to set a couple of different locations as "local" for that purpose.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Emilie, thank you for your kind words. We will discuss with the team on how we can incorporate multiple locations in future updates. In the meantime, you can follow topics that are location-specific for relevant news. You can find more details in our Help Centre article ‚ÄúHow to Follow Your Favorite Topics or Interests‚Äù.

scraped_reviews.content: Subscibed. Potentially very interesting and valuable approach to the news, but app is NOT easy to navigate. A bigger problem is that they keep losing my paid subscription. I paid for a year but benefits only last a few weeks, app keeps asking me to subscribe and downgrades my account. Customer services corrected this the first time but don't even respond now. The 'restore subscription' button doesn't work. Waste of money.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi M, thank you for subscribing to Ground News and sharing that feedback with us! You're right that there is a modest learning curve to using Ground News. We have a brief tutorial for how to use the latest design update here: https://help.ground.news/en/articles/1835265 . Please let us know if you have any other feedback at feedback@ground.news .

scraped_reviews.content: Seems pretty cool so far; it does what the YouTube pitchers promise. But I don't like how it uses, as many apps do these days, an embedded browser instead of the one I set as default in my device's settings. Yes, you can click an icon in the upper right of an article and it will then send you to your preferred browser, but this requires you to first load the article in the embedded browser. I'd like the ability to have all links skip the embedded browser and jump straight to my preference.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Robert, thanks for your 4-star review and feedback. I'm glad to hear you're enjoying Ground News so far, and I've recorded your feedback to share with the team to see if we can improve this aspect. If there's any other way we can improve your experience, don't hesitate to let us know over at feedback@ground.news . Thanks for your support.

scraped_reviews.content: It's a great service. The app could use a little improvement. My main issue is when reading articles in the built-in browser, there's no way to properly go back if I click a link in the article. The links work and will go to the right page, but using the back button/gesture exits the article back to the story summary, making me have to find the article again and reload it (the browser is a bit slow at loading). A little tedious in those cases. But overall good app and insightful service!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tony, thanks for sharing that feedback! Our team will review your comments as we work on navigation improvements. I am glad to hear that you are enjoying Ground News otherwise. Please don't hesitate to share any more feedback with our team over at feedback@ground.news!

scraped_reviews.content: I have set my notification preferences three times and the app is still trying to have me turn on notifications. If I can change it anytime in the settings, then stop nagging me. If I want notifications, I'll enable them. I don't. As for everything else, most things appear to be locked behind a paywall and the "news" is just snippet text. At that point, just show the headline only if we have to click through anyway.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Justin, unfortunately there is a bug that is resulting in this pop up issue. If you contact us at feedback@ground.news we can share the instructions to fix the bug (there is not enough space in the Google Play response box). You can use the Sort & Filter menu to hide all paywalled sources and focus your search on free access articles.

scraped_reviews.content: Does not work well with dark mode. It used to, but one of the more recent updates must have broken it. I used to pay for premium, but don't anymore. I think, other than a few minor annoyances removed, premium doesn't get you much. You still have pay walls from individual sources blocking access. The most useful thing is that you can see who has covered the topic, and then it's often better to open the source of your choice in your browser, because reading in the app can have issues.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Chris, you‚Äôll be glad to hear that the latest app edition is rolling out, and the dark mode issue has been fixed. Please update to the latest version. You can also remove paywall sources by using the Sort & Filter menu. We are not familiar with the issues while reading in the app‚Äì if you could share them with us, we‚Äôd love a chance to fix them.

scraped_reviews.content: it's okay... I don't really get the hype. Interface is clunky. Articles are often obnoxiously short and riddled with ads, popups and links, everything but substance. The bias trackers and other "features" are mostly useless, and probably biased themselves. I got the pro plan it's cheap and still doesn't feel worth it. I thought I would use it all the time. I consume news, politics and economics probably more than I should. Maybe my expectations were off, I'll update if my experience improves.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Anthony, we're sorry to hear about your experience. We would like to have the chance to improve your experience with Ground News and resolve your concerns. Please don't hesitate to reach out to our team at feedback@ground.news and we'll be more than happy to help!

scraped_reviews.content: I really wanted to like this app, as it appeared to have priorities straight. However, the privacy is a major concern with this app. A tracking blocking software reports that within just 10mins of use over 10,000 tracking attempts were blocked and this app feeds 70! companies that collect personal information from within my device: birthdate, GPS location, gender, email, first name, cookies etc. That is unacceptable, especially for a subscription based service.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi JP, we completely understand your privacy concerns. Transparency is at the heart of what we do and you can learn all about what data we collect and why we collect it (for product improvements) in our privacy policy: https://ground.news/privacy-policy. Our team at feedback@ground.news would be happy to answer any more questions you might have.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a great app if you are into the news. It's been one of the best news hub in the form of the app that I have ever found. I even paid for the yearly subscription on their high tier plan but unfortunately in just a few days, I deeply regretted my act. It's due to the serious security issues. This app opens the gate to countless trackers and ads when you like to access the source of the news you are interested in reading. And if you know how to block those issues, you get nothing. Two stars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mega, thanks for your feedback and I'm sorry to hear about your experience. The trackers you're seeing are from news sources' external websites. You can also reduce the ads you see by clicking the golden icon in the top right corner of the app in any story. I hope this helps improve your experience.

scraped_reviews.content: I LOVE the idea, but the app just shows the same articles over and over with no way to close them or mark them as red. makes the app almost unusable. they do a good job of helping you to understand whether there is bias in the articles, and they show you multiple versions, which I really appreciate. They are also more granular in their options when you say that you want to see "fewer articles like this". But I really don't want to see the five articles over and over and over!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Dan, thanks for your review. I've shared your feedback with the team so we can continue to improve this aspect. If you have any other suggestions for improvement, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at feedback@ground.news . Thanks for your support.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a very important app, but it frustrates me how limited the free version is. It's pretty well known that most people aren't going to pay to read news they can find for free. Pop-ups you can close and ethical ads from reputable companies could solve this. I can basically scroll three times before being told I need to subscribe. This isn't going to be effective to help people's biases if they can't access more of the app without paying. You can't even decide if you like it or not?

Better than average, I guess. I've been using this for months, premium, & noticed a few things. 1) the short story synopsis uses some charged terminologies. The short blurb doesn't refrain from placing a stance. 2) Despite my efforts to put topics I don't want to see in the "show me less" catagory, they will still show you more than you would think for these topics. It is another subtle way this app shows the stances it wants you to see or be important to you.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tropical, thanks for your review and feedback. The summaries are not editorialized by anyone on the team and are created by AI. I'm sorry to hear the "show me less" feature is giving you trouble. This is an issue with how the articles are categorized in the back end, and we're working to improve this as we speak. Thank you for your support.

scraped_reviews.content: I purchased the annual subscription, there was no trial period, and have used the app for 2 months now. It is VERY frustrating! Basically, the only things that one can do easily is read some article titles. Reading articles itself is extremely frustrating because of commercials, requests for subscriptions, etc. Some articles open in Spanish. Topics selected for My Feed are equally chaotic. In summary, all this app does is aggregate links to articles, but reading these is not given and not easy
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Javor, you are correct that the articles can be quite busy. We don't make any money off of ads and our sole revenue stream is subscriptions. The ads that you see are run by the publishers and we legally can‚Äôt remove them. Can you email feedback@ground.news? I'd love to hear more about these issues in order to assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: Bait and switch, period! By "Bait and Switch", I mean you don't tell us that there's a fee, monthly fee or subscription fee, up front! Any amount of a fee, to continue the use of the app, other than the normal fees of buying an app just to get rid of ads, should be printed on top, in the ad, not until you have the app set up. Bait and switch is when you HIDE the extra fees or subscription fees and a person only finds out, after we start using the app. I can't believe the author doesn't know what Bait and Switch is.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Ground is a free app, with optional pro features. We give all new users a week to test out the pro version, and if they don't wish to upgrade, they are automatically converted to the free version. We cannot/will not bill users without their permission. Ground's free version still has plenty of customization options and does not run any ads.

scraped_reviews.content: I'm giving 4 stars only because I like the core idea of making it easier to consume news while adjusting for bias. In practice, the app does not control for embedded articles which renders much of the ranking and bias-identification useless. For example, one story was marked as being 65% left, 15% neutral, and 20% right. But the 10 "sources" for the story were all just copies of the original AP article on different news sites. The article itself was neutral, so all this extra info was useless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Austin, thank you for your feedback. I'm happy to clarify that the ratings refer to the news sources, not any particular article but I understand what you're saying. An upcoming update on the website will show the original source and any repeated articles as "collapsed" underneath, would you want something similar for the app?

scraped_reviews.content: I love the concept, but the app has a long way to go. The UI is ugly and cluttered and not at all customizable. Certain news sources I just *never* want to see can't be filtered out entirely. "Less like this" doesn't work because the tags are often wrong. Adding interests is also limited - there's no search or manual entry; you just have to scroll through subjects sorted by trending and popularity. And worst of all: you have to read the news on the individual outlets' ad- and popup-filled sites.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mike, thank you for your review. Your feedback has been shared with our developers. It is possible to use the search bar to add interests to follow, are you looking for something that's not listed?Please feel free to email me at feedback@ground.news, I'd be happy to hear more about what you're seeing so that I can help improve your experience.

scraped_reviews.content: Like others have said, needs a preference to open articles directly to the default browser. Also, needs more controls on what is shown to me. For intance, I don't need to see what topics are trending every time I open the app, it's just more junk to scroll past. Would also be nice to be able to filter out topics. Finally, having a limit to my blocked sources is weird, considering how many are absolute rags.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alex, thanks for your review and feedback. I've shared your thoughts with the team so we can continue to improve. I have a few tips to improve your newsfeed, do you mind emailing us at feedback@ground.news ? There isn't enough room in these comment boxes to write them out. I look forward to hearing from you.

scraped_reviews.content: I really tried, it has a great premise but too many fails in execution. Latest issue, a limit on number of sources you can block. Many are behind paywalls so you can't access them. Not to mention missing many major sources. Honestly, I'll keep lower level of membership bc their chrome extension is great and I do hope app gets better bc premise is great. Check their web portal and you will see how lacking the app truly is in comparison.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Adam, thanks for the feedback and I'm sorry to hear about your experience. We'll work on improvements based on your feedback and we hope to bring Ground News closer to meeting your expectations in the future.

scraped_reviews.content: I don't typically write reviews for apps, but I had to make an exception here. Ground News is AWESOME. This is absolutely essential journalistic work, especially in today's news landscape. It's important to challenge your biases and break your bubble - Ground News makes that easier. It's reasonably priced, easy to use, and highly customizable. Cannot recommend enough.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you, Noah, for taking the time to leave us a 5-star review. We're delighted to hear that you find Ground News awesome and essential in navigating today's news landscape. If there's anything else we could do to improve your experience, please let us know at feedback@ground.news .Thank you for the support!

scraped_reviews.content: I downloaded this app when the logo represented its existence as a common reference, loved it. Now that the logo represents a state of being damaged and worn down, I have to say that the free version very much matches that. I did not expect a paywall merely to compare headlines. Reading competing stories, we could understand, but nobody should pay just to look at the teaser... I would recommend skipping this app until they can roll back to the previous business model.

Downloaded the app, liked what I saw and decided to pay for the subscription since it's so affordable. But as soon as I paid for the monthly fee I was immediately locked out. The app forces you to link to your Google, Facebook, Twitter, or other email account but then gives an error when attempting to sign in. Canceling, uninstalling, removing from my Google approved apps and changing all my passwords. What a disappointment and huge waste of time
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Liz, we've released many updates since you posted this review, including a new UI and new features. Please contact Feedback@Ground.News and we'd be happy to walk you through creating an account!

scraped_reviews.content: This is a great app, and I was excited about the concept. BUT for people who are trying to limit exposure to the 24/7 news cycle, I do not recommend. This app send multiple "breaking news" push notifications every day. There is an option to reduce the number of notifications, but it did not make a difference. After selecting 1-2 notifications a day, I still continued to receive many notifications all throughout the day, every day. The personalization features don't make a difference either!

Decent, but if you want me to subscribe again, you'll have to do better: repeat articles, headlines leading to random news that are unrelated to what I clicked, outdated stories that are "not found" once clicked, etc. Until then, I've cancelled my subscription. It wasn't much of an improvement over the free version. For all the money you spend advertising with my favorite YouTube Creators, one would imagine you'd have a more impressive platform. Gee, thanks for the cut & paste reply..
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Christoph√´r, thanks for your updated review. We've made it easier to focus on different perspectives. When a news story is reposted from a single outlet, you will only see that version of the story once, as shared from its original news source. Please feel free to email us at feedback@ground.news so that we can further improve your experience.

scraped_reviews.content: I have no issues paying for my content, I generally have a problem with a new NEWS service saying $5/month, but charges for a year.... I would've had NO problem paying for a month, to make my decision, but we're not given that opportunity.. 7 days, barely enough time to find out what you're doing.... Just because "influencers" says it's great/BUY IT, I need to find out for myself.... may have to pass.. Really?? Gaslighting?? There is nowhere that shows this.. I have screenshots..
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear A. J. W. (A.J.Dubs26), thank you for your feedback. We're sorry for any frustration this has cause and we'd like to ensure information about our services is accurate. We'd be happy to receive the screenshots at feedback@ground.news so we can investigate this further.

scraped_reviews.content: I love getting a balance of news so I can see what all sides are saying while knowing the non-bias is giving the facts. However, the app has gotten frustrating to use. I used to be able to choose whether I saw stories based on timeline or bias. I loved being able to easily see where a story originated. Sometimes, it showed it started from Russia, and was deliberate misinformation. Now, it seems to randomly pick which story shows first, it's hard to navigate, and I've lost all control. Sad!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Phyllis, happy to report the sort by bias/time function is still in the app. Whenever you open a story, just tap the "Sort & Filter" icon in the Full Coverage section and choose whether you want to sort by bias or time, then hit "done".

scraped_reviews.content: The app overall is great, enabling you to keep up date with news much more effectively than trending searches or hashtags. It is my only source for news and the one I will continue to use, as it is a phenomenal aggregator. It is not perfect, though. Bias Comparison is a pointless feature, as the AI just spits out word vomit at you that oftentimes makes no sense, and even when it does, is not very useful. I think general categories(charged/calm/distant/etc) would better describe things.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jerry, thanks for taking the time to share that feedback with our team ‚Äì we are glad you are enjoying the general app experience, and we will share your feedback about the Bias Comparison with our product team. We'll continue working on improvements ‚Äì if you have more feedback for us, don't hesitate to reach out at feedback@ground.news.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, but the recent update makes it very difficult to browse news articles. I keep getting this weird "rubber band" drag effect to the top. Slowed down my browsing speed to a crawl, and makes it a struggle to try and use it for even 2 minutes. ü´§ Glad I haven't paid for anything yet - Aug 13, 2024: Yay, you guys fixed it!! üëçüëç Edit #2: ü´§ it's still there
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Geoff, I'm sorry to hear about your experience. We have never had this issue reported before, and we'd like to learn more. Would you mind sharing more details via email to feedback@ground.news with screenshots as this will help us identify the issue? Uninstalling and reinstalling can be a quick fix to unusual problems ‚Äì please give it a try.

scraped_reviews.content: Too soon to tell. Only gives headlines to pay only website articles. UPDATE: Having used the app for a few days, I have found it DOES provide more than just headlines. Many are full articles, and most show the same story from different news outlets across the plotical spectrum for comparison. Very useful approach that I normally do manually.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Robert! Ground News offers news from over 50,000 sources, many of which are free. We actually label all paywall sources so it's easy to avoid them, and you can filter paywalled news sources out if you have a Ground News subscription. :)

scraped_reviews.content: I really like this app. I think they are working hard to provide clarity in this era of misinformation. One group of issues I have with the app is the ability to click on links. It would be helpful to make it easier to click on links within the articles (sometimes the page moves so you can never actually click the link), have the ability to open a link in a new tab, or go back to your spot if you did click a link. In that last case, it always kicks me out of the article.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jay, thanks for your kind words and feedback! We're happy to hear more about the issue you're experience regarding the ability to click on links with the page moving. Can you include any screenshots or recordings of this issue? You can reach us at feedback@ground.news as we'd be happy to investigate this further.

scraped_reviews.content: Very cool and useful app. I'm a believer that truth tends to lie somewhere in between on a given topic. It's hardly perfect, and you could argue that some bias exists even when trying to rate given articles from given sites as being left, center, or right, but I can appreciate what they're trying to to do. If nothing else it gives easy access to multiple reports on a given topic to easily read for yourself and come to your own conclusion. Highly recommend
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the 5-star review, Jeff. I'm glad to hear you find Ground News useful in today's news environment. If there's any way we can improve your experience, don't hesitate to let us know over at feedback@ground.news . Thank you for your support.

scraped_reviews.content: I like this idea quite a bit, but would prefer if there was a setting that allowed me to change the reader view button functionality to open it in my default browser instead (Firefox with adblocker). It would also be great to have the app icon be themed with the system colors (easy to implement). Please keep it up, I'll update my review as the app gets better!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ian, thanks for your review and candid feedback. I've shared your thoughts with the team so we can continue to improve. To pair the app with your system colours, kindly head to Profile > Settings > System Mode. To better improve your experience, please feel free to reach out at feedback@ground.news . Thanks for your support!

scraped_reviews.content: All of these people complaining about it not being free and that there's limited access is a huge facepalm. There's plenty there for free if you know how to navigate the app properly. The developers deserve to get paid for their work and the subscription for EXTRA(!) features helps with that. The app provides a service that isn't available anywhere else, it isn't just another news feed. I like being able to see what others think about a set of articles and the personalization aspect of the app.

There is alot to like about this app. That being said, the fact the the ability to filter out articles with paywalls is, itself, paywalled is a bit maddening. Foreign sources seem prioritized by default.....the only way to change that? You got it, pay. I was going to pay till seeing basic functionality withheld like this. I pay when a service is good, not after being withheld features. Add to that the fact that sharing links is basically impossible and I'm just let down.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Christopher, we're sorry to hear about your experience. We don't prioritize foreign sources but we're happy to hear more about your concerns if you'd like to reach out to feedback@ground.news . We're a subscription based service so that we can continue to work on improvements and we don't need to sell subscriber data this way.

scraped_reviews.content: Ok, I've given it a subscription shot. The app experience is meh at best, you can't share an individual story, you have to jump through so many hoops, the dark patterns in this app are obvious and bewildering. When I tap on a story, open it in my preferred browser, how hard is that? Nope, gotta get those ads. The bias stuff is ok. I really don't find myself caring though, also, I don't know how content sharing works, but this app takes away already precious views from news sources.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Brian, I'm happy to clarify that we don‚Äôt make any money from ads and the ads you see are from the publishers themselves. By directing directly to the news source, the sources themselves continue to receive views and they can support themselves through their ad revenue. GN itself is subscriber-supported. I hope this helps clarify things!

scraped_reviews.content: I like it a lot. I love that it gives you quick summaries of stories, it shows you multiple articles on a story from a range of sources, and you can see "blind spot" stories you might not hear about otherwise. I think the free plan is enough for most people, and the pro plan is very reasonably priced. The only things I dislike are how tapping a summary weirdly brings you to an article, and the back arrow doesn't always bring you to the article you were previously on.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the 4-star review, Stephen! Glad to hear that you're enjoying the range of coverage and Ground News' summarizer. We'll continue to work on improvements based on your feedback and we hope to bring Ground News closer to meeting your expectations in the future.

scraped_reviews.content: I wish the app developers good luck, but -- sadly -- I am uninstalling because the app's share links are to the app's own article hub rather than the actual site you are attempting to share. That makes it impossible to use the text-to-speech feature in Android that I rely on. For those who don't care about sharing, you may find this to be an excellent app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Larry, thanks for the kind endorsement. We will continue to listen to community feedback about the method of sharing from the app and use it to inform our next updates to make this feature much better for the future. We hope to welcome you back!

scraped_reviews.content: Great if you want to see the media's angle on all the issues in one place. You can literally press the slider from left to right or vice versa and see the difference of opinion in the headlines alone! Allows for reactions and comments as well! I only wish the comments sections were a little more in depth and allowed for replying and thumbing up and down of individual comments. Just to get more discussion going. I also recently had an issue with my posting of comments and it was quickly resolved

It is a great idea and it actually works occasionally. The idea of aggregating stories on the same subject from different sources and then ranking them based on lean intrigued me and I downloaded the app. It'll work about 75% of the time. The entire app won't load sometimes, sometimes stories won't load. It's patchy at best. Hopefully they'll iron things out but as of now they won't be getting my money. But maybe one day ü§û
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Dylan - Glad you like the concept but sorry to hear that the app isn‚Äôt working as intended. We‚Äôve seen a net decrease in usability issues on Ground, so your feedback concerns us. Can you please send us a message at feedback@ground.news so our dev team can get a better idea of the issues you‚Äôre experiencing?

title: Pocket Toons: Comics & Webtoon
description:
Find your next favorite comic on Pocket Toons - home to captivating webtoons, manga, comics and graphic novels from brilliant creators!

Download Pocket Toons, the official webtoons app from Pocket Entertainment, where you'll discover thousands of bite-sized stories across every genre imaginable. With our revolutionary pay-per-chapter model, you only pay for what you actually read ‚Äì no monthly subscriptions, no commitments!

Why Readers Love Pocket Toons

üÜï DAILY FREE UPDATES: Fresh episodes every day - no more waiting for weekly drops!
üéØ FREE WITH ADS: Unlock free episodes by watching quick ads
üé≠ DIVERSE GENRES: From romance webtoons to action comics, fantasy adventures to slice-of-life stories
üëç USER-FRIENDLY COMICS READER: Intuitive interface designed for the perfect reading experience
üö´ NO SUBSCRIPTION: Say goodbye to monthly fees and commitments
üí∏ PAY PER CHAPTER: You only pay for what you read with our unique micro-transactions model

 Endless Comic Genres to Explore
üíïRomance: Sweet romance manhwa & webtoons, CEO romance, campus love stories & heart-fluttering relationships
‚ú®Fantasy: Otherworldly adventures, isekai manga, cultivation manhwa, magic academy stories & dungeon survival tales
üëäAction: Martial arts manhwa, revenge stories, monster hunter manga & superhero webtoons
üòÇComedy: Rom-com webtoons, gag manhwa, school life stories, and hilarious misadventures
üëªMystery: Detective manhwa, psychological thrillers, horror webtoons, crime stories, & supernatural investigations
üåüDrama: Family drama manhwa, historical webtoons, medical manga & office life stories
üê∫Urban Fantasy: Werewolf romance, vampire tales, modern magic webtoons, paranormal manhwa & mythology retellings
üëëRoyal Stories: Palace intrigue, princess manhwa, reincarnation stories, villainess tales & historical romance
üéÆGame Stories: LitRPG webtoons, gaming manhwa, VR world adventures, leveling systems & dungeon tales
üó°Ô∏èSystem Stories: Regression manhwa, tower climbing webtoons, monster evolution, game system stories & power leveling
üíé Premium Reading Experience

- Vertical Scrolling: Optimized for seamless mobile reading
- High-Resolution Artwork: Enjoy vibrant colors and detailed illustrations
- Customizable Settings: Adjust text size and use day/night mode for comfortable reading
- Bookmark System: Never lose your place in a story
- Reading History: Track all your favorite series
- Auto Recommendations: Discover new comics based on your preferences


 Affordable Entertainment - Pay As You Go

- Daily Free Chapters for every series
- Micro-Payment System: Only pay for episodes you want to read
- No Hidden Fees or monthly commitments
- Special Bundles and discounts on popular comic series
- Daily Rewards and bonus credits through regular activity
- Offer Wall lets you unlock free episodes by watching quick ads

 Discover these must-read titles in every genre:

- üíïRomance: Saving Nora, The Boss's Shotgun Wedding, Sweet Bite Marks
- ‚ú®Fantasy: God Eye, My Vampire System
-üöÄ Sci Fi: Apocalyptic Super System
- üëäAction: Super Cube, Insta Empire
- Ô∏è‚òïSlice of Life: Zero Point Idol, The ‚ÄúGiantess‚Äù Wants Love
- üëªHorror: Statue


What Makes Pocket Toons Different

Unlike traditional comic apps that lock you into monthly subscriptions, Pocket Toons revolutionizes digital comics with our innovative pay-per-chapter model. Our cutting-edge technology ensures that entertainment never stops, with new episodes of your favorite manga, webtoons, comics, graphic novels & books releasing DAILY!

Join Millions of Readers Today!

Whether you have five minutes or five hours, Pocket Toons fits perfectly into your lifestyle. Join our growing community of comic enthusiasts and discover why readers worldwide choose Pocket Toons as their go-to comic reader app!

 Connect With Us:
- Instagram: @pockettoons.official
- Website: pocket-toons.com

DOWNLOAD NOW and experience the new age of comics with Pocket Toons!

summary: Pocket Toons: Free Webtoons, Comics, & Manga - New Chapter Drops Everyday

scraped_reviews.content: Forces you to choose a comic out of an arbitrary list, rather than the full library, which might not even include the one you saw in the ads (it didn't for me). Also, the comics seem to be AI-generated, though it isn't 100% obvious if you're not looking for it. I noticed blatant errors like the MC's earrings growing 10x between consecutive frames and a guy with 6 fingers on one hand, though. Clearly they keep up their "new chapter drops everyday" by churning out pages with AI.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We‚Äôre working to expand our library and improve content quality. We appreciate your comments and will share them with our creators. Hope you find comics you enjoy on Pocket Toons!

scraped_reviews.content: I've been reading Saving Nora, but recently more and more issues arise with the app. First, I haven't read the comic in three/four days because I've been busy, so I thought 6 episodes would get unlocked. Only the two I didn't get to read last time were unlocked. No new episodes. Then I watched an ad to read at least one new episode today, and yet again, it didn't unlock any episodes! I want to keep reading, but I'm about to delete the app because it's so frustrating...
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Natalia, we're sorry to hear about the issue with unlocking episodes. We do provide daily free episodes when you visit the show and use the app. Please share your details at pockettoons.care@pocketfm.com, and our team will look into it and help you out as soon as possible. Thanks for your support! üíñ

scraped_reviews.content: The toons themselves are quite good, both in art and narrative. However, there's few options to earn coins, only to buy. I spent 40mins filling in a survey for coins only for a message to come up at the end that I was unsuitable, after answering around 200 questions. If there was a reasonably priced weekly subscription to unlock toons, I'd consider it. I won't spend hundreds of dollars unlocking a single story though. Ridiculous. Uninstalling.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback ‚Äî we‚Äôre glad you enjoyed the art and story! We're sorry about your experience with the survey. These are managed by third-party partners, and eligibility can vary. We‚Äôll share your suggestion about a weekly subscription with our team. Appreciate you giving us a try!

scraped_reviews.content: The stories are really great. The art is fantastic. The problem is the cost. When you buy coins is hardly opens any chapters, even if you spend A LOT. They have these options to play games and get rewards, only you don't get the rewards. Even when I tried to get help to get the rewards they said I didn't earn them, so that was a scam. I really love the stories on the app, just not the cost.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you so much for your feedback and for enjoying the stories and artwork! We‚Äôre sorry to hear about your experience with the rewards. To help us look into this further, please email us at pockettoons.care@pocketfm.com with the details. Our support team will be happy to assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: I waited an entire day for the next chapter to unlock, only to open app and find it still had 22 hours to wait. Can only watch a single ad daily to unlock a chapter. The amount of tokens isn't worth the price, especially when some of the comics have over 200 chapters. also when I tried to give the review in app I was unable to give a bad review, couldn't move the keyboard to actually post.

I'm enjoying the content but the app is frustrating. After the beginner allowed chapters, you're allowed two a day unless you watch a couple of ads or pay coins. Even if you miss a day or two and you think that you racked up some extra chapters to read because you have been getting notifications from the app that a new chapter has opened, when it actually hasn't is annoying. So figure on taking your time reading through a story if it's over a few hundred chapters and many keep going and going.

Online Graphic Novel/Great Graphics! With enough different & varied plots, there's always something for everyone. Also, story length perfect? Not too short (so you don't feel shortchanged). Not too long (so they're not repetitive/boring). In fact, stories draw you in from first frame/s & keep up the tension, no matter if you know how the story ends! Would recommend. In a heartbeat.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Dear Florence,
Thank you so much for your thoughtful and detailed 5-star review! We‚Äôre delighted to hear that you‚Äôre enjoying our online graphic novels the stories, artwork, and pacing. It‚Äôs wonderful to know the variety and story telling kept you engaged from start to finish. Your recommendation means a lot to us.
Regards,
Team Pocket Toons.

scraped_reviews.content: Stories are okay. But after initial free episodes, you can only unlock 1 episode per day! It totally ruins the reading experience having to wait 24 hrs for 1 short chapter! There's no reward system to let you unlock more episodes for free! It's just a cash grab and some stories drag on endlessly w/no sense of completion in sight! Stop being greedy and let readers watch 1 ad to unlock chapters!!!! ü§îüôÑü§¨ü§¨ü§¨üò°üò°

You get so many episodes free, but then they cost a considerable amount to unlock the seasons are long and drawn out so you're spending a lot of money to actually read anything worth while. You also can't skip episodes which is unlike any other reading app out there. I'm deleting it. You can buy 160 coins with a bonus 40 for $19.99 but it takes 9 "coins" to unlock an episode. You're essentially paying $1 per 10 coins or $1 an episode. A 600+ episode series costs $600!!??? Yeah- no....
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns about the cost and episode structure. While many episodes are free, some paid content helps support our creators. That said, we truly value your input and are constantly working to improve the user experience.
