title: Lifesum: AI Calorie Counter
description: A revolutionary way to track your meals, enhanced by AI. Welcome to a new era of nutrition tracking, tailored to your style. With the new Lifesum experience, you can choose to log your meals by snapping a photo, using your voice, typing a text, or scanning a barcode. We made food tracking easy so you can make more healthy choices for your body and mind. JOIN 65 MILLION USERS ON THE PATH TO BETTER HEALTH. Health isn‚Äôt about perfection‚Äîit‚Äôs about progress. Lifesum encourages small, manageable changes that add up to lasting results. Whether it‚Äôs drinking more water, adding more fruits and veggies to your plate, or choosing healthier snacks, Lifesum celebrates every win, no matter how small. SMARTER, SIMPLER MEAL TRACKING üì∏ Snap a photo to get instant nutrition details. üéô Speak for easy, hands-free logging. ‚å® Type for more detailed tracking. ‚úÖ Scan barcodes for fast info. ‚ö° Use quick tracking for simple entries. TOP LIFESUM FEATURES üî¢ Calorie counter üìä Macro tracker and food rating ü•ó Diet plans for weight management and body composition ‚è≥ Intermittent fasting plans üíß Water tracker üçè Fruit, vegetable, and fish tracker üìã Meal plans with grocery lists included üèÉ Integration with Google Health for in-depth health monitoring ‚ö° Life Score test for personalized nutrition recommendations WEIGHT MANAGEMENT AND HEALTHY EATING Whether you're looking to manage your weight, eat healthier, or simply feel better in your everyday life, Lifesum provides the tools and support to make your goals achievable, sustainable, and enjoyable. From balanced meal plans to specialized lifestyles like keto, paleo, or high protein, Lifesum adapts to your preferences and needs. Simply share your goals, preferences, restrictions, and activity levels, and Lifesum creates nutrition plans just for you. Lifesum also offers a massive library of delicious recipes, all crafted to help you eat smarter without compromising on flavor. BEYOND CALORIES: A COMPLETE WELNESS SOLUTION Lifesum goes beyond simple calorie counting. With its unique Life Score feature, the app evaluates your overall health based on your eating habits, hydration, and activity levels. This helps you focus on long-term well-being instead of short-term fixes. ALL YOU NEED FOR A CUSTOMIZED EXPERIENCE ‚úîCalorie counter, with the option to adjust your daily calorie goal and add/exclude calories burned through exercise. ‚úîMacro tracking and adjustable goals for carbs, protein, and fat intake. ‚úîCreate and save your favorite foods, recipes, meals, and exercises. ‚úîBody measurement tracking (weight, waist, body fat, chest, arm, BMI). ‚úîA library of thousands of recipes with smart filters for quick results. ‚úîA weekly Life Score based on nutrition and exercise measurements. ‚úîTrack and integrate with Wear OS - A calorie tracker, water tracker, or view your exercise on your watch face. Add complications to the home screen for faster logging. The Wear OS app works independently, so it doesn't require the Lifesum app to be downloaded. The Lifesum app integrates with Google Health allowing users to export nutrition and activity data from Lifesum to Google Health, and import fitness data, weight and body measurements to Lifesum. Lifesum is free to download and use with limited features. For the full Lifesum experience, we offer 1-month, 3-month, and annual Premium auto-renewing subscriptions. Payment is charged to your credit card through your Google Play account at confirmation of purchase. Subscription renews automatically unless you turn off auto-renewal in Google Play account settings or cancel your subscription at least 24 hours prior to the end of the subscription period. View our Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy: https://lifesum.com/privacy-policy.html
descriptionHTML:
A revolutionary way to track your meals, enhanced by AI.
Welcome to a new era of nutrition tracking, tailored to your style. With the new Lifesum experience, you can choose to log your meals by snapping a photo, using your voice, typing a text, or scanning a barcode.
We made food tracking easy so you can make more healthy choices for your body and mind.

JOIN 65 MILLION USERS ON THE PATH TO BETTER HEALTH.
Health isn‚Äôt about perfection‚Äîit‚Äôs about progress. Lifesum encourages small, manageable changes that add up to lasting results.
Whether it‚Äôs drinking more water, adding more fruits and veggies to your plate, or choosing healthier snacks, Lifesum celebrates every win, no matter how small.

SMARTER, SIMPLER MEAL TRACKING
üì∏ Snap a photo to get instant nutrition details.
üéô Speak for easy, hands-free logging.
‚å® Type for more detailed tracking.
‚úÖ Scan barcodes for fast info.
‚ö° Use quick tracking for simple entries.

TOP LIFESUM FEATURES
üî¢ Calorie counter
üìä Macro tracker and food rating
ü•ó Diet plans for weight management and body composition
‚è≥ Intermittent fasting plans
üíß Water tracker
üçè Fruit, vegetable, and fish tracker
üìã Meal plans with grocery lists included
üèÉ Integration with Google Health for in-depth health monitoring
‚ö° Life Score test for personalized nutrition recommendations

WEIGHT MANAGEMENT AND HEALTHY EATING
Whether you're looking to manage your weight, eat healthier, or simply feel better in your everyday life, Lifesum provides the tools and support to make your goals achievable, sustainable, and enjoyable.
From balanced meal plans to specialized lifestyles like keto, paleo, or high protein, Lifesum adapts to your preferences and needs.
Simply share your goals, preferences, restrictions, and activity levels, and Lifesum creates nutrition plans just for you.
Lifesum also offers a massive library of delicious recipes, all crafted to help you eat smarter without compromising on flavor.

BEYOND CALORIES: A COMPLETE WELNESS SOLUTION
Lifesum goes beyond simple calorie counting. With its unique Life Score feature, the app evaluates your overall health based on your eating habits, hydration, and activity levels.
This helps you focus on long-term well-being instead of short-term fixes.

ALL YOU NEED FOR A CUSTOMIZED EXPERIENCE
‚úîCalorie counter, with the option to adjust your daily calorie goal and add/exclude calories burned through exercise.
‚úîMacro tracking and adjustable goals for carbs, protein, and fat intake.
‚úîCreate and save your favorite foods, recipes, meals, and exercises.
‚úîBody measurement tracking (weight, waist, body fat, chest, arm, BMI).
‚úîA library of thousands of recipes with smart filters for quick results.
‚úîA weekly Life Score based on nutrition and exercise measurements.
‚úîTrack and integrate with Wear OS - A calorie tracker, water tracker, or view your exercise on your watch face. Add complications to the home screen for faster logging. The Wear OS app works independently, so it doesn't require the Lifesum app to be downloaded. The Lifesum app integrates with Google Health allowing users to export nutrition and activity data from Lifesum to Google Health, and import fitness data, weight and body measurements to Lifesum.

Lifesum is free to download and use with limited features. For the full Lifesum experience, we offer 1-month, 3-month, and annual Premium auto-renewing subscriptions.

Payment is charged to your credit card through your Google Play account at confirmation of purchase. Subscription renews automatically unless you turn off auto-renewal in Google Play account settings or cancel your subscription at least 24 hours prior to the end of the subscription period.

View our Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy: https://lifesum.com/privacy-policy.html
summary: Calorie, food tracker, and nutrition insights to support your healthy diet.

scraped_reviews.content: After using this app for a few months consistently, it will not stop popping up fullscreen ads to sign up for premium MULTIPLE times a day. It is mostly good but the ads have gotten annoying. I would not sign up for premium anyways because the app frequently has incorrect nutrition information for scanned products, and there is no way to fix them besides sending a report that probably goes to the digital equivalent of a paper shredder.

the UI is great, but the AI tracking system for exercise and calorie/macro intake is often wrong, with a small pool of user-generated food items that usually are also wrong to replace them with, and unlike myfitnesspal, restricts the details of your custom items or workouts if its "unfeasible". made it annoying to use and distrust my actual progress since my calories burned/consumed was all over the place, so i cancelled my preem subscription. disappointing honestly

This is my go-to macro tracker. It has NO annoying ads, even when you're a cheapo like me and stick with the free version. The visuals are easy to understand and the interface easy to use. My one recommendation for using this is that you either scan barcodes or you double-check the app's nutrition info with Google. The app has almost every brand and variation of food out there, and the downside is that it's easy to pick the wrong option unless you already know what you're looking for.

Horribly designed app, AI has ruined it. It can't even take simple instructions, or read labels, or do basic math, even in the "premium" version. For example, I tell it the EXACT macros I ate, and that apparently is too much for its little AI pea brain, it will try to calculate far less than what I ate, or 5 times. Never the exact amount. Lifesum was a great app prior to the takeover of AI. Avoid it, and try to find something AI-free, or maybe just a calculator and a notebook at this point.

update: since last year this app is even more inaccurate. I cant believe it's spent money to renew my subscription. I am done with this app. I found a free one that tells correct information. ............. I like the app however when scanning in food for Keto it's very inaccurate and the options are limited. It's very confusing trying to figure out net carbs. I'm not sure I will keep using this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your rating and sorry to hear that you had a bad experience with our app! Please, feel free to contact our support team at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support with your questions. A support agent will get back to you as soon as possible.

scraped_reviews.content: I don't plan on canceling my subscription. I do regret buying a year's service from them. Will I renew? It appears they get a lot of their caloric data using a dart board. I see many mistakes when I compare it to the package labeling. not big ones, but enough to be aggravating? They can't read barcodes where external barcode readers can. I suspect they have an inadequate database. Those problems should go away in time, as the database grows, but I hold little hope.

Overall good app. I've been using it for almost a year. it's definitely better than most. The water tracker is almost totally useless because you can't manually put in your oz. The barcode scanner is occasionally pointless and I wish they could fix some of the complications with the quantity selections being so erratic. But overall it's been helpful. You can only see so much info with the free version and that's been a let down. I'll keep using it, but I also don't have 5 star reviews for it.

*Update: Adding food by text has become very sporadic with a something went wrong message way too often* Mostly a good experience but the AI can frustratingly change things. I've been using the subscription service for almost 2 months. It has been working well for the most part. But the AI can change things. When I add something to the meal and it changes items I've previously added.

I really enjoyed this app until it went AI. now I'll add something, close the app and come in and everything has changed. barcodes are constantly wrong. I manually input info and it'll change it to. it's basically impossible to keep this app tracking correctly. cancelled my membership I've been paying for 4 years and moving over to my fitness pal

You can't adjust your daily calories unless you pay for premium. That's outrageous!! Advertisement showed photo uploads for food logging, but that also is nowhere to be found as a free feature, nor was it disclosed as a premium feature upfront before downloading and giving them my info. I'm not paying for bare minimum user controls that come standard on other apps like Lose It. This company can kick rocks.

Not worth anything more than the free version and if you try to get a hold of their developers or customer service, forget it! Tried to contact them via their provided email address and got crickets. The full version, which the charged $100 for, is money wasted in my case. So sorry I didn't cancel.

Just oddly glitchy. So many of the items come out just slightly wrong such that you always have to be comparing this app to other sources. It will sometimes arbitrarily change portions you add to seemingly random numbers that can seriously alter the amount of calories you think you're consuming. Almost there, I think, but needs work.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that you're having a bad experience with our app! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the issue at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support? A support agent will get back to you as soon as possible. Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

scraped_reviews.content: This app was really good when I started using it in January, but it seems to get worse every update. Recently, all of the calorie estimates are wrong, and the most recent update doesn't even let you search for corrections. It just takes you back to the "multi-modal" tracking window with the same incorrect macros.

updated review: this has only gotten worse, it's a total crapshoot of how much numbers will change each time you add food (even previous entries), which makes this completely unreliable even as a diary. I'm uninstalling, I've given this time to get better and it's causing more frustration than it's giving support.

the free version is pretty decent compared to other apps. I like that I can scan barcodes or search to track food, I also like how it adjusts based on the exercise you do each day. a lot of features are locked :( but the subscription is crazy expensive so idk if it would be worth it.

I really liked this app at first. However, after a while I found it more and more frustrating. For one, there are a list of options for items if you can't scan it. There are sooo many options to track each food with different amounts of ounces for what a cup is, the calories and sugar in it. This makes it super inconsistent. If I happen to not have a barcode for something or if I have a barcode this app can't scan, often the options are inaccurate to their actual nutrition.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. It‚Äôs a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors. We are constantly working to fix these errors but recommend tracking foods marked with Verified by Lifesum.

scraped_reviews.content: For the most part, it's a pretty good app. My biggest problem is when I scan a barcode and it comes up with something completely different. Either the food or the nutrients. I've tried to edit the nutrients for several different foods only to be told that "it doesn't match up for calories (or some other entry)". Makes me wonder at times why I am paying for it!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We understand your frustration with not being able to save corrections to our database due to our +/-5% security limit. This prevents incorrect values from being added. If package info appears wrong, it may be a manufacturer error. We're working on less restrictive rules. You can create your own food item under Favorites in the Progress tab

scraped_reviews.content: Have used the app for two weeks now (free version), everything I need is here and it's great. However, after the last update it made me install and set up Health Connect on top of Google Fit. Before that all the syncing went smoothly, but now it doesnt seem to add the calories burnt while walking (only shows duration and steps, but no calories), and it also doesnt sync the weight anymore. Please look into this syncing issue, its really frustrating.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: To continue automatic exercise imports, connect your exercise app to Health Connect, then link Health Connect to Lifesum. This ensures accurate data transfer for a seamless experience. Thank you for your cooperation!

scraped_reviews.content: I tried a few different tracker apps and this one was the least cumbersome. It's pretty to the point and quite easy to track. However, when scanning foods, it's not 100% accurate. It'll show a higher/lower calorie count than what's on the label. Two biggest drawbacks - not being able to delete a food from the app as a whole and not being able to give a food item, your own description. Example: "Happy Harvest Cut Green Beans." This makes things a little more difficult to find.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. It‚Äôs a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors. We are constantly working to fix these errors but recommend tracking foods marked with Verified by Lifesum.

scraped_reviews.content: Just doesn't really give good nutritional advice. Everything, including roasted nuts, are "processed" foods according to it. The calories on some foods are really off and it can be really hard to use it as a tracker. I've used much better apps. The search function is also perry terrible and there are not intuitive units for foods. It will say "standard serving" but won't tell you how big the serving is. It just needs much more work to be usable.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. It‚Äôs a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors. We are constantly working to fix these errors but recommend tracking foods marked with Verified by Lifesum.

scraped_reviews.content: I am a nutritionist. I like the app but there are some problems. I have noticed that some of the nutrition information isn't correct, so you have to double check the numbers. Because of that, I gave it one less star. It also is hard to lose weight with the nutrition guide lines they make, so because of that I gave it one more less star. If you want to just track your food, it will work for you. Edit 4/3/2021 - They have made significant changes and have improved the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Many thanks for your review and your comments - we truly appreciate your feedback and wish you all the best with your goal!

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this for a year or so. They changed the layouts and not as user friendly. During the week I eat most of the same items. When I go to "quick add" it takes 5 steps to add one of my favorites. When I go to favorites, I'd like to be able to add multiples at once. Unless there's another way I'm not finding in the quick add, only one green check mark at a time. Lots of extra time to track and I find myself using it less and less because it isn't quick.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: If you would prefer the old tracking view you can easily change back to the old version. This can be done under Settings -> Customize Diary. If you have more questions or would like to give us some more feedback, please reach out to us here: https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support . Thank you for your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: I decided to pay for this app so I can connect to my Fitbit. Very cool that it tells you how many calories you've burned and tracks how many you have left based off of that. But you have to manually connect to the Fitbit every day instead of it automatically staying connected. Also can be glitchy ex. Calorie count will randomly change back and forth. Which is frustrating because the apps main focus is calorie counting.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We sincerely apologize for the troubles you've had with the app. We'd be happy to take a look into this for you, please contact us at: https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: The app is nice and prompts you to update often but a lot of the numbers tend to be inaccurate. Another knock is the fact that you need to upgrade to premium to keep body measurements in the app. Because I already keep track of the measurements in the app (and more) this isn't a huge deal but it would have been nice to keep all in one place. I guess I need to check out other apps. Another knock is that you can't delete a food if you find a more accurate food in your search.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Please feel free and contact us with more details at contact@lifesum.com so we fully understand what you mean and can help you solve your issue. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is very broken right now. I've used lifesum before and really liked it. I re-downloaded it recently and even got the three month subscription, but this time it is so different! The tracking doesn't work on the home screen - I only see how much I've eaten when I go into the summary. For a food tracker, I expect it to at least let me track my food! I'm really disappointed in the app and the fact that I spent money for a broken service!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: If you would prefer the old tracking view you can easily change back to the old version. This can be done under Settings -> Customize Diary. If you have more questions or would like to give us some more feedback, please reach out to us here: https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support . Thank you for your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: Best diet tracking app I've used. I have noticed that the cholesterol tracking isn't accurate. As an example, I eat chicken often and the cholesterol amount always states zero when added to the diary. A little disappointed about that, and hopefully the other stats are accurate. I like the many recipe suggestions and diet type options, I use the 6:1 diet plan and have lost 12 lbs in 2 months. I did upgrade to the annual plan and feel it's 100% worth it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your feedback and review! We are sorry to hear about the issue you mention. Can you please directly contact our support team with more details? An agent will get back to you as soon as possible. You can reach us here https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support - thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: The food library is very limited, even when you input the barcode it might not find it. Also, when I am adding a food it does not let me see what I have written, it just comes up with options. I don't know if this not supposed to be like this, maybe it is just a bug in my phone but it is annoying. Other than that, the platform has an appealing aesthetic design and does the job of calorie counting so it is fine.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for the inconvenience Laysa. A fix enabling users to save items under Favorites with a new logic is on the way - we hope to soon be able to launch the version. A solution, for now, is either entering values that sum up correctly or to use the simple tracking feature. Thank you for your patience! Best regards!

scraped_reviews.content: Really not digging this new update. 2 many steps 2 add an item to proper meal. Then when you find the item & are on the edit serving size there's no way to select which meal to place it. You have 2 add it, hope it adds to the correct meal then move. Also, when you do select the meal you want it to go to, then select favorites, it forgets which meal you picked & places it in a random meal. Difficult to search by name for an item not favorited. AI feature is ok, but clunky. Might head back to MFP
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We would like to let you know that you can switch back to the old tracking view if you would prefer that. This can be done under Settings -> Customize Diary. If you have more questions or would like to give us some more feedback, please reach out to us here: https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support .

scraped_reviews.content: My use case was a diet diary. My first effort was to put in a favorite with nutritional information. Kroger's mixed melon. After several hours I gave up. I found there was an update. It may be that the update was to try to fix this with a Google nutrition etc database beta. Sigh. Anyway, visually nice. I think they tried to graoh on an ugly UI for crowd sourcing nutritional data. If so, they may have not realized that local nutritional labels can be designed to be not useful.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: So sorry to hear about the issue you are experiencing! Please contact support directly at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support and they will help you sort this out quickly. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Definitely NOT worth $50. The app is okay. The database of food info is as inaccurate as any of the free apps. Almost every time I had to fix or add info, which made me regret paying $50. Lifesum will not budge on the 14-day refund which tells me I'm not the only one asking for one. The daily calorie intake is also fixed to a few preset goals, so you can't make your own calorie goal.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry to hear that you're not satisfies with Lifesum. You can change your calorie goal when following the Classic diet plan. Our food database is partly user-created and that results in items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you select items verified by us or create custom items under Favorites.

scraped_reviews.content: Since 2018 I loved the app for its ease of use and the free features, like the recipes and the meal plans. Around 2021 more premium options became available (i.e., newer meal plan types, specific diets to follow, etc), I didn't mind the change because I had the choice to choose premium or stay with the free option. I tried Lifesum premium a few times, and ultimately decided to stay with the free options. Now after almost a year off the app, all the free things I loved are lost. I'm disappointed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, we will forward it to the responsible team. As you mention some new parts of the app now consist of paid content. The reason for this change is for us to iterate and improve the app even further. Please feel free to contact our support team at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support for a free trial!

scraped_reviews.content: Love the app but exercise record inaccurate. Have been using this app for a few weeks and love how easy it is to track my macros and other nutrition! The ability to create custom meals and recipes was a huge game changer for me compared to other apps. I also love that this app will automatically update the my calories burned/fitness activity from my Samsung Health App. However, I noticed that Running is counted as its own exercise, but double counted within my total daily steps... fix??
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will inform the responsible team regarding your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: I was really enjoying the convenience of this app until today. Previously they showed each meal with total calorie count for each. Click on the meal or snacks bar and you could see what you already recorded and easily add more. Now you can't see the summaries. When I click add. I have to chose method of input. Then which meal, then the food itself. More clicks and way less useful. Added: thank you for the info. Pls work on adding more info with the updates so we don't have to ask.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We would like to let you know that you can switch back to the old tracking view if you would prefer that. This can be done under Settings -> Customize Diary. If you have more questions or would like to give us some more feedback, please reach out to us here: https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support .

scraped_reviews.content: I just started using the free version of this app 6 days ago to help pay attention to what/how much I eat & the nutritional value. I use the tracker portion of the app (meals, snacks, & exercise). I like that it's quick & easy (LOVE the barcode scanner). The thing I DON'T like is that the nutritional information is often DRASTICALLY incorrect. I spend 5+ minutes per item reporting the incorrect information, and I end up doing this AT LEAST once per day. I'm going to look for a different app.

A friend recommended this program so I foolishly jumped in with both feet. Too many negatives to list. Adding a food near impossible and otherwise problematic. The quick add feature allows you to add calories but no descriptor. You cannot export your data unless you email them to do it for you. Cancelling the program doesn't refund any portion of your subscription fee (which, to be fair, you are warned about but it is still bad business).

Listen, this app works. I loved this app so much, I paid for premium because it's on sale and you get recipes and a grocery list. Here are the problems... 1. Most recipes are caviar, and smoked salmon etc. They aren't cheap recipes. 2. Make the grocery list merge. When you add the same meal onto your meal planner on your grocery list 8 times will be the same items just randomized. It is a simple code to write, just add the items together. thank you
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your review - we truly appreciate your feedback and wish you luck with reaching your goal!

scraped_reviews.content: It's hard to enter home cooked meals. Gives too many restaurant options. I've paid for 3 months and I will not be renewing my subscription. I have been unable to add my information for the past 4/5 days because it's not loading when I type. Like last night I had roasted chicken for a meal. It just is busy and won't load. Honestly, I'm very disappointed. I do NOT recommend this app at all.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are very sorry you are experiencing this! Please contact us a https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support for support or for a refund.

scraped_reviews.content: I'm a MFP refugee. This app is everything MFP isn't. The interface is beautiful, adding a food doesn't take me 40 minutes, their prompts to get the paid version are present but not intrusive. The food database isn't quite as robust, but since you can add to it, it's not that big a deal. The widget is beautiful. I would like the ability to customize which information shows on the widget. I'd want my weight instead of water, as water is tracked on a different app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for all your positive feedback Allison! We're super happy to read you enjoy the app. We hope to add more functionality in the future to those features you're mentioning. We wish you all the best with your goals and do not hesitate to contact us if you have any doubts or questions about the app. Best Regards

scraped_reviews.content: Tried as a replacement for myfitnesspal. Free version has very minimal functions (no barcode scanner) but subscription is far cheaper than myfitnesspal which I like. However, there is no website interface, only the app. So I'm going to go with Cronemeter instead because it has more functions in its free version and a website interface which I use for data review and graphing. However, if you're looking for app only and cheaper subscription, this app may work well for you.

Think it doesn't fit my personality to update every meal and snack because I stopped using it after about a month. Still while I was using it, it worked. Really keeps you aware of your intake and helps to moderate. I like the barcode scanner functionality. I was surprised how many products were already in their database. And what wasn't could be added which is great.

The best calorie tracking app I have found out of all the ones I've downloaded. This one allows so many basic features free to try out without having to pay and it is very user-friendly and beautifully designed. And the ads are not right in your face all the time. I'm considering upgrading to the payment plan now! Whereas the other apps made me so annoyed that I didn't want to pay them
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Many thanks for your review! Please, feel free to contact our support team at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support for a free trial!

scraped_reviews.content: Great app to track nutrition and exercise if you don't need to custom set macros. Its beautiful, easy to use, excellent food database. I'm using the free version and love the features. The paid version seems to have even more helpful features and I look forward to upgrading at some point. For now, the only thing I've been limited by, though, is the free version only has the ability to create 2 of your own recipes (upgrade for unlimited). You can still quick add the calories from recipes if you already know the stats.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for leaving all your feedback! We are glad to hear that you are satisfied!

scraped_reviews.content: Good setup but poor execution. I've had the app a bit over a week, I paid for a sub to get advanced access to food tracking and after a few days I noticed the nutritional information for the fooda I enter were off. After going back a few days I noticed the same for everything I entered. I found I could report these issues and in some case I could "edit" them as well but none of that changed what I was entering. Having the wrong info can be Dangerous for people.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. It‚Äôs a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors. We are constantly working to fix these errors but recommend tracking foods marked with Verified by Lifesum.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a great app, and would be deserving of 5 stars. However, there is a bad glitch over the last month with recipes and meals. It does something weird with the carbohydrates where if you change the serving size it multiplies the carbohydrates so if I'm having a half portion of something it will double the carbohydrates instead of half them. Uninstalling and reinstalling doesnt fix it. That's a terrible glitch for someone who counts carbs. I love all the rest of it but this will keep me from resubscribing. I'll have to use another app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing Lisa. Have you reported it yet? Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I like the design of this app. It's simplistic and easy to use. However, I'm dissapointed in the lack of features I have access to. I can't afford the premium, so I'm stuck with the default diet instead of a diet more accurate to what I need. At this point I'm only using it to make sure I drink water and eat enough calories per meal, which I could do on my own. While Premium isn't a bad idea, I would just like more accesability with the meal plans/other diets.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you very much for your feedback!  

Please feel free to contact support at contact@lifesum.com for a free trial to Premium so you can test all features.

scraped_reviews.content: Good for keeping track but could definitely use some improvement. When you go over calories (even by a large amount!) it says the same thing "you did good today! just go for smaller portions!" it is kind of silly to say that when I go over calorie count by 1500. Unless you are really good at guessing the grams or oz of food you eat, you will have to do a lot of googling. A lot of things are only available with premium, so people who are bothered by upgrade ads will not like this app much.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks so much for providing all this valuable feedback! Please reach our support at contact@lifesum.com if you would like to report any issues with the app. All the best with your goals :)

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app but I have one major complaint. I wish that when you searched for food it would put your already tracked food at the top of the list. It's kind of annyoing searching up stuff you eat all the time. I know there's a recently tracked but it's just as annyoing having to scroll through everything you've eaten and sometimes you won't find it because you tracked it for lunch but now your tracking dinner. Please just make this faster to do.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your review! We will inform the responsible team regarding your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: Decent app. Like the design and love the ability to scan food directly into the estimator. Do have a few issues. Doesn't always save if I delete an item from my list of foods or change the quantity (I put food in ahead of time to plan). No algorithm to take metabolism into account. Left guessing how many calories I actually need. Nutrition record by subscription only. Would rather purchase. Having trouble entering new items. Required ml or grams for serving. Don't know how to calculate those.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We deeply apologise for this! Please contact support directly at contact@lifesum.com and they will help you sort this out quickly. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I paid for premium on this app last week. The concept is great but I felt like it was lacking. When logging food the calories and macros were not accurate, which is a big deal when trying to lose weight. However I did like the the daily reminders and encouragement. Unfortunately I have emailed the company to ask for a refund. Hoping in the future they can offer a free trial so you know what you are getting before having to pay for it to avoid situations like this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback Lindsey! I hope you have received a refund if you're not satisfied with app. 
We wish you all the best with your goals :)

scraped_reviews.content: Easy to use, fairly cheap compared to other for monthly charge. However a lot of the foods seem to have the wrong info. Calories and carbs are always off even though they say "varified" and some items like burger buns come up as hotdog buns. Gets a little time consuming having to make a new food every time the item is wrong, which is at least 1 item per meal. It's getting to the point I don't want to use it. When I create a new food it errors and says calorie value is incorrect when it isn't.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback on the app's usability and pricing. It's concerning to hear about the inaccuracies with food data and the issues you've faced when creating new entries. We invite you to reach out through our support options in the app to share more about these challenges. Your input is vital for continuous improvement.

title: Hopper: Hotels, Flights & Cars
description:
The Hopper app has helped over 100 million travelers find and secure the best price on flights, hotels, homes and car rentals - each and every time they book their trips.

Book Flights, Hotels, Homes & Rental Cars 
Find millions of flights, hotels, homes, rental cars (and cute bunnies) ‚Äì all in one app. Book your trip safely and securely, in just a couple taps and a swipe. 

Always Get the Best Price 
You can watch a trip right in the app and we‚Äôll send you a notification when it‚Äôs the best time to buy ‚Äî recommending you to book now, or maybe wait just a little longer.

Easily Find The Cheapest Travel Dates 
Simply search your preferred destination and use Hopper‚Äôs color-coded deals calendar to easily find the cheapest travel dates for your trip.

Not Ready to Book Right Away?
Hopper lets you freeze the price, so that you never miss a travel deal. For a small fee, take the time you need to finalize your plans, or wait for your next paycheck to come in. If the price goes up, you only pay the price you froze it at. But if the price goes down, you just pay the lower price. 

Travel with Confidence
Avoid fees and frustration! Make any trip flexible with Hopper‚Äôs Cancel and Change for Any Reason plans. Get instantly rebooked without extra costs if your flight is delayed or you miss a connection with Hopper‚Äôs Flight Disruption Guarantee. Travel stress free with 24/7 access to Hopper‚Äôs Customer Support. 

Help the Planet, One Booking at a Time. 
With every booking that occurs on Hopper, we pledge to plant 2 trees to offset the carbon footprint. To date, we‚Äôve planted over 31 million trees. 

Hopper has no ads, no spam, and no stress ‚Äî just accurate predictions and travel deals.

So what are you waiting for? Start saving money with the bunny today. Download Hopper for free now, and let‚Äôs start planning your next trip!

Hopper Love
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúThe 10 Best Free Apps for Air Travel Junkies‚Äù - TIME
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúThe app helps travelers find the cheapest flights, hotels and rental cars.‚Äù - The Points Guy
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúCompared to exact searches on Expedia, Kayak and Orbitz, we regularly found that the deal quoted on Hopper was the best‚Äù - Travel and Leisure
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúFind me a hotel on Hopper!‚Äù - The Late Late Show with James Corden
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúHopper is committed to offsetting the carbon emissions of every flight and hotel stay it sells.‚Äù - Forbes, The Top 100 Most Customer-Centric Companies of 2022

Say Hello to the Bunnies
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hoppertravel
Instagram: @hopper
Twitter: @hopper
Website: http://www.hopper.com

Need support? Head over to https://help.hopper.com to find answers to frequently asked questions. You can also reach us toll-free at +1-833-933-4671 if calling from US or Canada, or at +1 (347)-695-4555 if calling from outside the US or Canada.

summary: The best way to book travel

scraped_reviews.content: I'm on the free trial of the paid version of the app, and it's missing buttons like "submit" in the Traveler Details section. The UI is not user-friendly, and it is very difficult to select desired options in the Wishlist section. The search option will not enable you to narrow down flight classes. Instead, it has its own verbage for flight classifications, which leaves the true meaning unclear. Some features are nice, but it needs a lot of work in the Android version.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, Elizabeth Morales! We see you're facing challenges with the interface, particularly in the Traveler Details and Wishlist sections. We‚Äôd love to help resolve this. Please call us anytime at our 24/7 toll-free number: +1-833-933-HOP1 (+1-833-933-4671). Hopper Team

scraped_reviews.content: Yet another garbage app. Does not provide any savings at all. Now they are contacting me to waste even more of my time to address the issue, so I will say more here. There was an ad that showed if anyone used their calendar and clicked on the green days that you could could pay $38 for a four star hotel. That is not the case and I clicked on a bunch of them.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, Michael Wagner. We value your concerns about expected savings and appreciate your willingness to share them. Our team is dedicated to addressing any issues you encounter, so feel free to contact us anytime at our 24/7 toll-free number: +1-833-933-HOP1 (+1-833-933-4671) for support. We're here to help. Hopper Team

scraped_reviews.content: A friend who vacations a lot recommended this app to me. I was hesitant because I didn't want to sign up for a filling of adds unrelated to what the app provides (booking rooms). Hopper did not disappoint and it still continues to be the my go to for booking affordable and great rooms for all of my trips this year. I recently recommend Hopper to a friend who wasn't too sure about the app. He booked his room through Hopper.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Richard JV, thank you so much for your wonderful feedback! We're delighted to be your go-to app for booking. Your trust and recommendations mean the world to us. Wishing you amazing adventures ahead! Hopper Team
